title: 4 Paws for Ability at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Veterinary
mission: We are a certified 501(c)(3) college chapter of 4 Paws for Ability, a nonprofit service dog training organization. Our mission is to spread and support 4 Paws for Ability’s mission of enriching the lives of people with disabilities by placing life-changing service dogs while educating members of the club and members of society about service dogs and their importance.
membership_benefits:
- Interact with our service dogs in training
- Fun events with our dogs: General Meetings with Guest Speakers, Training Sessions, Member Socials, Fundraisers, Collaborations, & Field Trips
- Opportunities to foster/train/raise a service dog in training
- Become a puppy sitter for our service dogs in training
- Learn more about service dogs, how to interact with service dogs & their importance
- Volunteer hours (if you're a certified handler)

title: 4-H House Cooperative Sorority
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural, Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: 4-H House is a cooperative sorority that serves as a home away from home for 55 women at the University of Illinois at a lower cost. The sorority was founded in 1934 by 4-H member Mary McKee. In 1980, we joined the University of Illinois Greek System, and the opportunities available to 4-H House women were broadened. We are involved in numerous activities throughout the year, including Little Sister and Little Brother Weekends, Mom's and Dad's Day Weekends, Formals, Exchanges with Fraternities, and Philanthropic Activities.
membership_benefits:
At 4-H House, we do all of our own cooking and cleaning. Jobs are divided by members of the house based on seniority. Girls have the option of cook or dish crews, and either a shorter, daily cleaning house duty or a more intensive weekly house duty. This helps keep costs at a minimum and teaches valuable life skills.
Member of 4-H House also govern themselves. House meeting and chapter meetings are held on Monday evenings. All house members, including new members, elect the officers for the house each semester. The ten house members elected to the Executive Board provide the main leadership for the house. There is also a Junior Executive Board consisting of the remaining elected officers. They plan activities throughout the semester such as rowdy half hours and study breaks during Finals Week.

title: Academic Buzzer Team: A Quiz Bowl Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission:
We're the Academic Buzzer Team at the University of Illinois. We participate in tournaments of quiz bowl, a competition between two teams in which players answer academic questions in categories such as fine arts, history, literature, science and social sciences. We also host tournaments at the high school and colligate levels and produce question sets for use at other tournaments.
"Regular" questions are called "Tossups", and they are written with many clue, with harder clues proceeding easier clues in what is called "Pyramidal" structure. This way players with deeper knowledge of a subject can give correct answers earlier, rewarding extensive knowledge. A team that answers a tossup correctly is given a bonus, as set of (Usually) three related questions that only the controlling team may answer.
If this sounds interesting to you, join us at one of our practices. Mondays and Wednesdays at 6:00 - 9:00 PM room 123 of the English Building, or feel free to send us an email.

title: ActGreen
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Environmental & Sustainability
mission: Act Green is a sustainable business club dedicated to demonstrating how environmental responsibility aligns with economic success. We believe that integrating sustainability into business is essential for balancing profitability with the preservation of our planet's resources. On campus, Act Green explores the nature of sustainability in business through meaningful discussions and the development of solutions that benefit both the campus and the greater community. As we move forward, it is crucial to recognize that environmental consciousness and profitability can, and should, go hand in hand.

title: Action Against Hunger at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: Action Against Hunger's mission is to eliminate hunger and malnutrition, especially among the more vulnerable populations worldwide, by addressing the causes of hunger and making sure communities have access to resources and support. Action Against Hunger is a worldwide nonprofit dedicated to saving lives and helping to end hunger with over 8,900 aid workers. Specifically at UIUC, we are a smaller chapter hoping to make a small difference on campus. Our mission is to volunteer at a variety of places to aid individuals in their fight against hunger, raise funds to support the international organization, and take part in small acts that can help others in many different ways.
membership_benefits: Members of this organization are involved in many different volunteer activities where they learn a variety of skills and learn a lot from the experiences the organization presents its members. Some of the trainings can include knowledge on nutrition, health, water, sanitation, and hygiene. In addition to trainings, membership in this organization can provide experience in humanitarian work, which can benefit individuals in their own personal development or future opportunities that members want to be involved in. Next, members have the opportunity to network with other members in the organization as well as interact with people in less fortunate circumstances at soup kitchens, bake sales, fundraisers, and more. Finally, members are able to have a sense of community within the organization with so many members looking to give back to the community and participate in the organization to make a difference in others' lives.

title: Actuarial Science Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Actuarial Science Club is a student-run organization which communicates with the Actuarial Science Department to provide our students with career, social, and networking opportunities. In the fall, we run about 15-20 company presentations with recruiters from insurance and consulting firms to help educate students about industry trends and help them find internships and full-time positions. Additionally, we run a large-scale career fair called Meet the Firms in late September each year. We also host workshops to help our members develop essential skills for their professional life. More events pop-up throughout the year including our field trips to companies and annual spring banquet.

title: Adventure Club
tags:

mission:
Heed the call and join the Adventure!
Adventure Club offers a one-of-a-kind social experience where lasting friendships are forged through the fun and flames. Each member is sorted into one of four teams competing in weekly “Adventures”; from scavenger hunts and trivia to creative challenges and outdoor games. Outside of Adventures, we host regular socials like local trivia nights, group outings, camping trips, and more!
If you're looking for connection, community, and just enough chaos to make college unforgettable, Adventure Club might be exactly what you're looking for.

title: African Students Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture, International, Social & Leisure
mission: The African Students Organization (herein referred to as ASO) mission is to create an enabling environment for African graduate students, support and prepare Africans who transition from the African continents to pursue a degree, especially graduate students, at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and to offer training and leadership services to such students that will serve the African continent and help relieve it from the socio-political and economic crises that ravaged its member states for over centuries ago. The organization through its social and campus activities; education programs, leadership seminars, conferences, community events, etc., will showcase truths about the African continent, correct false narratives about Africa and her cultural heritage to the University community, and build a strong cohesion among Africans on campus.
membership_benefits:
1) Voting Rights
2) Ability to travel with ASO
3) Free admission to ASO events

title: AIESEC Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Athletic & Recreation, Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Environmental & Sustainability, Identity & Culture, Ideology & Politics, Performance Arts
mission: AIESEC in UIUC is a local chapter of AIESEC in the United States which is a part of AIESEC, a Global, non-partisan, independent, not-for-profi t organization run by students and recent graduates of institutions of higher education. Its members are interested in world issues, leadership and management. AIESEC does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, creed, religion, national, ethnic or social origin. AIESEC, through its affi liation with the United Nations works towards a better and more sustainable world.
membership_benefits: Joining AIESEC offers students and young professionals a unique chance to grow personally and professionally. Members develop leadership, teamwork, and project management skills by taking on real responsibilities in areas such as marketing, events, and operations. AIESEC also provides opportunities to work in diverse, multicultural teams, fostering cultural intelligence and global awareness. Through its international exchange programs, members can experience new cultures, expand their networks, and contribute to impactful projects aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals. The organization’s supportive environment includes training, mentoring, and conferences that strengthen confidence and communication skills. In addition, AIESEC membership enhances employability by giving practical experiences that stand out on a résumé, while also connecting members with a vast global alumni network. Ultimately, AIESEC helps young people step outside their comfort zones, make a meaningful impact, and prepare themselves for leadership roles in an interconnected world.

title: Alpha Chi Omega
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Alpha Chi Omega is a national women's organization that enriches the lives of both its collegiate and alumnae members through lifetime opportunities for friendship, leadership, learning, and service.
membership_benefits:
Recognition
Members are recognized in chapter communications and at graduation with honors regalia.
Networking
Members have access to networking opportunities and can form lasting connections with other sisters.
Career support
Members can receive help with resumes, informational interviews, and mentorship. They can also access a member directory, business directory, and job and internship postings.
Publications
Members can access Alpha Chi's publications online, including the undergraduate research journal Aletheia and the annual member community magazine Kalo.
Leadership opportunities
Members can practice leadership through involvement in local chapters, at the regional level, and at the national level.
Shared housing
Members who live in a facility where Alpha Chi Omegas have a presence are typically required to live on for at least one year. This shared living space can strengthen the bonds of sisterhood.
Career Conversations
Members can participate in the Career Conversations program, which matches mentees with alumna mentors who have experience in areas of interest.

title: Alpha Sigma Omega Latina Sorority, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: As sisters of Alpha Sigma Omega, we preserve to authenticate the emancipation, scholarship, unity, and endurance of all Latino and Caribbean people. Through solidarity we promote the tie that binds us all and those same ties that broke us free from slavery some time ago. In order to promote omnipotence our goal is not to replicate societal mannerisms. We achieve this through research knowledge of our culture, people, and conception. Knowing everything we should and must know as women, we promote, practice, and educate all others of the injustices that occurred long ago and continue today by forbidding them from happening in the future. The future is within our reach. There are no longer boundaries to prevent us from knowledge we must attain. Former laws, beliefs, and bondage have paved the way for the mission and purpose of Alpha Sigma Omega Latina Sorority, Inc.

title: Also Known As Improv (AKA Improv)

mission: Also Known as Improv serves as the campus’ only “no-audition” Improv team, providing mentoring, workshops, events, and performance opportunities for anyone who is interested. We also welcome those who are already on an Improv team and want to participate more, as well as those who did not make auditions and would still like to participate/learn to be able to audition for next year.
membership_benefits: Anyone is welcome to attend AKA Improv meetings! If you attend, (and reflect on what you've learned before you leave), you'll earn a gold star. Collect 5 gold stars, and you'll officially become a full-blown member of AKA Improv. Full members get a spotlight Instagram post (if you want one), first chance at any AKA Improv swag, and are added to the official One Illinois page.

title: Altgeld Ringers
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Performance Arts
mission: In previous years, our goal was to enrich the UIUC campus and the surrounding community by continuing the long-standing tradition of chimes playing at this University (since 1920). While we want to preserve and recognize our history, we also wish to continually think forward in how we can engage with the rest of campus and its diverse group of students through our musical choices. With the chimes out of commission, our goal is to continue engaging with the university community, other RSOs, and even other universities to preserve the strong tradition of bell ringing ingrained in the university's culture. Furthermore, we plan to engage with archival work that can preserve the historical aspects of the chimes for future performers and listeners. The bells may return in the next academic year, and, if so, we will reopen the tower and begin sharing music with campus again!

title: Alzheimer's Disease and Dementia Alliance
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: The ADDA serves to host fundraising events for Alzheimer's and dementia related organizations, raise awareness on proper care and treatment for affected individuals, and discuss current research and medical practices in the field of Alzheimer's and dementia. As part of our mission, we aim to educate students on preventive measures to mitigate the risk of dementia, alongside providing support to individuals whose lives have been touched by this condition. By doing so, we will provide an outlet for those who are passionate about the disorder and allow an educational and philanthropic environment for those to be more involved in the Alzheimer's and dementia community at UIUC.
membership_benefits:

title: American Constitution Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The mission of the American Constitution Society is to harness these values of compassion and respect for each individual, and to re-incorporate them into American law and politics, in order to build a stronger and more decent national community. We seek to restore the fundamental principles of respect for human dignity, protection of individual rights and liberties, genuine equality, and access to justice to their rightful --and traditionally central -- place in American law. We want to strengthen the intellectual underpinnings of -- and the public case for -- a vision of the law in which these values are paramount. Our goal is a rekindling of the hope that by reason and decency, we can create an America that is better for us all.

title: Arpeggia
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission:
What Is Arpeggia?
Arpeggia is a Non-Profit 501(c)(3) driven to provide high-quality, affordable music education to children interested in starting their musical journey. Children are matched with musical instructors who serve as positive role models.
How Does it Work?
Arpeggia is designed to develop and enhance musicianship in individuals who want to learn about the language of music. Students, with the help of their mentors, explore the basics of music literacy and instrumental techniques through hands-on learning with the instrument of their choosing.
What Do We Offer?
Children gain the opportunity to develop their musical abilities and facilitate meaningful connections with instructors.
College musicians gain real-life experience in music education.
Parents see their children learn new skills.
Schools supplement their music education program.
How Do We Compare To The Competition?
Music apps are fun and inexpensive but provide minimal education. Arpeggia’s curriculum is specifically tailored to ensure students have fun while developing real musical skills.
The average private lesson costs $60/hour, making lessons inaccessible to many. In comparison, Arpeggia lessons are completely free.
Private one-on-one instruction with out-of-touch professionals is endurable for some children, but our group classes and workshops not only teach music in a fun manner, it allows students to build their musicianship with a community.
Who Are We?
Arpeggia is a group of multitalented students from the University of Illinois dedicated to making music accessible to all communities. The founders consist of 4 musicians with 30+ years of music and education experience between them. Arpeggia was born after winning Startup 54, a start-up competition at the U of I.
membership_benefits:
Benefits depend on your committee. Benefits include, but are not limited to:
Music mentorship experience with local children
Volunteer hours
Music Pedagogy Lessons
Website Development
Non-profit management skills
Accounting and Bookkeeping skills
Access to Canva Pro
Social Events
Other resume-building skills

mission: The Assyrian Student Association serves to celebrate and promote Assyrian culture and the Christian faith. Our goal is to provide a welcoming space for Assyrian students and friends alike to connect, engage in cultural and religious activities, and foster a sense of community.

title: Astrobiology Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences
mission:
To consider the possibilities of biology in space, allowing for the field to have a safe space within the university.
Linktree: https://linktr.ee/astrobio.uiuc

title: Astronomical Society at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission: The Astronomical Society at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign is focused around a love of the sky we observe and our vast universe. Our main purpose is to educate the students of the University and the members of the C-U community about the wondrous night sky! We are the sole RSO of the University where students can get access to telescopes and get trained on our dome telescope to make the most out of the wonders of astronomy.
membership_benefits: Members of UIAS have the opportunity to be trained on our 129-year-old telescope at the UI Observatory. Members also have the ability to travel with the club to Dark Sites, camping grounds, and to participate in EOH and other campus events. Members will have voting rights to select the Executive Board at the end of every academic year.

title: Aventa BHC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Social & Leisure
mission: Aventa BHC exists to help students become well-rounded leaders by growing stronger in three core areas: Business, Health, and Community. We provide beginner-friendly opportunities to learn business skills, without the barriers of formal interviews or exclusive pipelines. Aventa BHC provides general and mental health workshops and discussions that promote holistic self-improvement, and service events that strengthen our community. Our mission is to create an inclusive space where every student can build balance, confidence, and impact.

title: AWS Cloud Club - UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Information & Data Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The mission of the AWS Cloud Club is to foster a community of AWS enthusiasts, promote knowledge sharing, and provide opportunities for members to learn, experiment, invite industry speakers, and collaborate on cloud computing projects using Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies.
membership_benefits:
Cloud Education (Azure and AWS)
Cloud Activities and Labs
Speaker Events

title: AxisMED
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: AxisMED’s pre-incubation program will fill the gaps between the University’s academic resources, Carle Foundation, and business incubators by connecting students with the tools necessary to build their own early-stage ventures

title: Azerbaijan Student Association at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International
mission:
The Azerbaijan Student Association at UIUC (ASAUIUC) serves as the/to a
supportive community, promotes Azerbaijan culture, and encourages cultural exchange. We aim
to connect students and celebrate our heritage through educational and social events while
creating an inclusive space for personal and academic growth.

title: Badmaash Company
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International, Performance Arts
mission: Badmaash Company is a melting pot of Western and Indian music influences to create novel fusion performances. This organization offers a unique opportunity for its members to perform at popular events, jam with a diverse group of musicians, and potentially compose and release music on streaming platforms. Moreover, Badmaash Company strives to create awareness of and experience Indian culture.

title: Badminton For Fun
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission: The purpose of the Badminton For Fun RSO at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign is to provide a means in which students of any skill level can gather and socialize together while playing recreational badminton.

title: Ballet Folklorico Mitotiani
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
Ballet Folklorico Mitotiani is an organization meant to create an understanding and connection of Mexican and Latinx cultures through folkloric dance and represent the various diverse regions of Mexico on campus and within the Champaign-Urbana community. This organization is a safe space for many of our students because they know that they can feel connected to their roots when they watch or dance folklorico. As the Latinx population on this campus continues to grow, it is essential to celebrate and embrace the diversity within our community, demonstrating that the university values and supports its Latinx students.
Ballet Folklorico Mitotiani represents the regions of Jalisco, Sinaloa, Michoacan, Nuevo Leon, Chihuahua, Veracruz, Baja California, and Durango and is constantly working towards expanding these regions.

title: Balloon Design at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: Balloon Design at Illinois serves as to gather a group of balloon twisters or anyone interested in balloon design. We aim at spreading the joyful atmosphere that the adorable balloon works can bring us; meanwhile, we regularly train the club members to keep sharpening the balloon twisting skills in order to build a good foundation of the club.

title: Baltic Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: Baltic Club serves to build a welcoming community for Lithuanian, Latvian, and Estonian students at UIUC. Our goal is to create a space where Baltic students can connect with their peers, celebrate shared culture, and make campus feel more like home. Through cultural events, social gatherings, and collaborations, we aim to strengthen ties among Baltic students and share our heritage with the campus community.

title: Bangladeshi Students Association
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - International
mission:
To represent Bangladesh and Bangladeshi culture at UIUC.
To promote Bangladeshi culture, traditions, and heritage through various initiatives that familiarize our beautiful country Bangladesh with the diverse UIUC community.
To foster a sense of community among Bangladeshi or Bangladeshi-origin students within UIUC.
To uphold the interests of Bangladeshi students, deal with their concerns, and take responsive actions that would be beneficial to the Bangladeshi Community as a whole.
To nurture academic, professional, and social development of its members.
To help new Bangladeshi-American students get familiarized with UIUC and its surroundings.
To endorse cultural exchange between Bangladeshi or Bangladeshi-origin students and other student bodies.

title: Bankruptcy Law Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The purpose of BLS is to advance and promote the interests of members while maintaining a focus on bankruptcy law.

title: Baptist Campus Ministries
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: Baptist Campus Ministries serves as a student group aimed to provide fellowship and service opportunities for Christians on campus. Coordinate with the University Baptist Church to connect undergrads, grads, and professionals through Bible study, worship, and service.

title: Baptist Chinese Campus Ministries
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: As we follow Jesus Christ as He is the way, the truth and the life, BCCM serves as a student group aimed to help interested students and scholars on campus to know God, growing in love for God, God’s Word, and God’s people of different ethnicities and cultures. As coordinated with Champaign Love of Christ Church, this organization will seek witnessing to campus communities at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign through prayers, Bible study, worship, service to others and sometimes excursions/BBQ and funs. We shall also provide a welcome party to new participants each semester. Besides Chinese Bible study and preaching, English Bible Study and sermons were provided in the past years and hope to continue in the future.

title: Bar None
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: Politics, race, class, and sex cannot be separated from the law. As law students, it is our responsibility to understand the intersectionality of the law and these issues and how they invariably affect us all. Our goal is to educate and activate law students to become socially-conscious lawyers in whichever practice area they enter, as well as to keep civil rights at the forefront of their minds. We will work to uplift marginalized voices of all kinds through educational workshops and events. We aspire to serve as a resource for the general law student body to learn about these issues on a local, national, and global level. We pledge to work with organizations who are committed to establishing equal rights for all.

title: Barbells and Scalpels Fitness Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure, Health & Human Sciences
mission: The Barbells and Scalpels Fitness Club serves to empower students to develop a social network that engages them to set and pursue fitness goals, build their understanding of relevant anatomy, physiology, and nutrition, and engage in coordinated research and review projects to consolidate evidence-based fitness recommendations.
membership_benefits:
Members will be able to:
• Meet new friends and workout partners
• Build their understanding of the science behind fitness training
• Create and refine a personal fitness plan with the support of peers

title: Beekeeping Club at UIUC

mission:
the Beekeeping Club at UIUC serves

● to foster environmental stewardship within members and the University
● as a social space for environmentally minded students

tags:

mission: The mission of the BSO is to build a community within the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign that promotes, practices and celebrates rich and diverse Bengali culture at UIUC.

title: Best Buddies International
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure
mission: The mission of Best Buddies is to establish a global volunteer movement that creates opportunities for one-to-one friendships, integrated employment, leadership development, and inclusive living for people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD). We do this by matching student volunteers in mutually enriching friendships with persons with intellectual and developmental disabilities.

title: Beta Alpha Psi
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The mission of Beta Alpha Psi, the premier international honor and service organization for financial and business information students and professionals, is to inspire and support excellence by encouraging the study and practice of accountancy, finance, information systems, and all majors related to data analytics, providing opportunities for service, professional development, and interaction among members and financial professionals; and fostering lifelong ethical, social, and public responsibilities.

title: Beta Chi Theta Fraternity, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization

mission: The purpose of Beta Chi Theta shall be to assemble college students in a fellowship of the founding principles of this fraternity, the most important being brotherhood.

title: Beta Psi Omega
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences
mission:
The primary purpose of Beta Psi Omega is to help students help themselves. The overarching mission is to provide a supportive brotherhood for students pursuing careers in the biological sciences, and to further the advancement of biology as a science and a profession. The fraternity is committed to serving the needs of the students and thereby the community. Beta Psi Omega aims to provide passionate students with opportunities, insights, and guidance to
success.

title: Beta Sigma Psi
tags:
Blue Student Organization

mission: The objective of this Fraternity shall be to promote an organization of communicant Lutheran college men who shall recognize that the life rooted with Christ in God is the only true goal of human existence, and who therefore, foster, encourage, and inspire activities and relationships which promote this end.

title: Beta Theta Pi Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Its objects shall be binding upon each new and initiated member, which are the same as those set in The Code of Beta Theta Pi, especially as applied to the University of Illinois under which the chapter operates. It is the chapter’s mission to develop men of principle for a principled life, per the standards of Beta Theta Pi, and to uphold the highest standards of the Greek community at the University of Illinois (UIUC).

title: Bilingual Organization for SHS Students
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: The Bilingual Organization for SHS Students (B.O.S.S.) is an organization that encourages the study of bilingual speech and hearing sciences, share knowledge and experiences, provide opportunities for student-faculty interaction, and increase awareness of multicultural/bilingual issues in Speech-Language Pathology and Audiology.

title: Biomedical Engineering Journal Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The Biomedical Engineering Journal Club serves as to provide students of all majors an opportunity to refine their academic journal reading and analyzation skills in the Bioengineering field. It will also provide resources for those wanting to pursue graduate school or research, as well as opportunities to network with fellow students interested or already involved in research. There is currently no RSO in the Bioengineering department that places an emphasis on graduate school or research and no undergraduate courses taught that emphasize the importance and understanding of academic journals.

title: Biomedical Engineering Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The purpose of the Biomedical Engineering Society (BMES) shall be to promote the profession of biomedical engineering through the organized effort of this group in study, research, and discussion of the fields of biomedical engineering and the dissemination of knowledge thereby gained. The chapter shall promote membership in the BMES by acquainting the student body with the ideas, purposes, and objectives of BMES.

title: Bioscience Journal Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences
mission: Bioscience Journal Club is an open, welcoming place for undergraduate students to review scientific research papers. Members will collaboratively interpret papers from a variety of biological fields while practicing presentation, reasoning, and critical thinking skills. The club hopes to bring together academically driven students interested in staying up to date on new technologies and discoveries. Additionally, we highly encourage students of any background of study to come and join us. Members will have the opportunity to choose the club's topics and papers. We also plan to have a few professors on board to help us discuss their research.

title: Black Association of Psychology Students
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission: The Black Association of Psychology Students (BAPS) is dedicated to fostering a supportive, safe, and inclusive community for Black students pursuing and interested in psychology. Our mission is to advance academic and professional excellence through mentorship, advocacy, and collaboration, while promoting the integration of diverse perspectives into psychological research and practice. We strive to empower our members, celebrate our African diasporic backgrounds, and contribute to the advancement of the field by addressing the unique challenges and opportunities within the Black community.
membership_benefits:
Members of The Black Association of Psychology Students will have
the following benefits within the organization:
1) Access to community of other Black students interested in psychology.
2) Ability to participate in BAPS events.
3) Ability to develop academically and professionally within the field of Psychology.

title: Black Business Network
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The Black Business Network is built and designed to create professional opportunities for minority students on the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign campus. We are able to do this through the many different social, professional, and developmental and philanthropic events we hold each year. We show this through our commitment to our 3 pillars: Activism, Connection, and Enrichment. Through our pillars we will: create space for black students and allies (Gies or not) to learn more about the business world, open up networking opportunities for whatever career path students desire, create a safe space for black students to express their experiences within both academic and professional settings, develop our members and set them on track to be ready for their future careers.

title: Black Chorus at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission: Music 463, Black Chorus, is an academic offering within the School of Music; a registered student leadership organization; and partner with the Bruce D. Nesbitt African American Cultural Center for collaborative initiatives. Black Chorus is an embodied performance experience and the opportunity for stimulating scholarship of the music of Black Americans as art, aesthetic, and activism. With repertoire ranging from African chant, Negro spirituals, improvised hymns, formal anthems, and traditional and contemporary gospel, to blues, jazz, rhythm and blues, soul, and hip hop, Black Chorus has sustained a continual presence on the cultural landscape at Illinois with performances on campus at signature events, nationally for tours and festivals, and internationally at conferences and residences since its founding in 1968.

title: Black Creators Network
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Media Arts
mission:
Black Creators Network serves to grow and promote Black creators on the
campus of UIUC while building a limitless network of connections and opportunities.

title: Black Graduate Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Black Graduate Student Association of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign is dedicated to the academic, cultural, and professional development of Black graduate students enrolled at UIUC. The Black Graduate Student Association responds to the needs and concerns of all scholars of color, with particular concern to the specific needs of the Black student community and strives to improve their quality of education and life at the university.

title: Black Greek Council
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The Black Greek Council exists to be the sole collective governing body for predominantly Black Greek-lettered organizations, to promote unity among predominantly Black Greek-letter organizations and the African American community on campus and in the Champaign-Urbana community, to serve as a resource for the University of Illinois, the Greek community, and student organizations that addresses the concerns and needs of African American students, to promote and engage in public and social service activities for the benefit of the campus and African American community, to encourage, develop, and maintain leadership and scholastic excellence among individual members and member organizations.

title: Black Law Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The mission of the Black Law Students Association is to articulate and promote the professional needs and goals of Black law students, to foster and encourage professional competence, to focus upon the relationship of the Black law student and the Black attorney to the American legal structure, to instill in the Black attorney and law student a greater awareness of commitment to the needs of the Black community, and to influence the legal community to bring about meaningful change to meet the needs of the Black community.

title: Black Muslim Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture
mission: The Black Muslim Association serves to empower Black Muslims by promoting unity, cultural awareness, and religious understanding within the university and broader community. We aim to raise awareness of issues affecting Black Muslims through educational events, workshops, and community service initiatives. Our goal is to create an inclusive space where members can explore their identities and address challenges that arise at the intersection of race and religion.

title: Black Queer Collective at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: Black Queer Collective (BlacQ) serves as a safe space for Queer and Trans Black/African/African American identifying individuals to connect and build community through discussions, social events, and overall, through connecting culture through intersectionality.

title: Black, Indigenous, and Latinx in Tech - B[U]ILT
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
B[U]ILT serves as the/to serve as a strong support system for minorities in
computing and technology related fields, fostering scholarship, professional development, and a
sense of community and belonging through a network of members. The organization strives to
improve the diversity of the workplace in computing fields through technical and professional
events, as well as working on outreach to encourage future generations of students in
underrepresented communities to pursue a career in computer science and technology.
membership_benefits: B[U]ILT offers its members meaningful opportunities to connect with peers from similar, adjacent, and ally backgrounds; foster an inclusive community in tech; gain access to professional development resources; and create lasting memories that define both their college and professional journeys.

title: BLNKD
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: BLNKD is a portrait photography club that focuses on the collaboration between models and photographers! Our club's mission is to encourage creative freedom and allow individuals to live out their visions. We heavily stress that our club is a great starting point in the realms of both photography and modeling.
membership_benefits: There are portrait photoshoots every week that you can join! We also have workshops for both models and photographers too!

title: Blood Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: Blood Club supports the efforts of ImpactLife Blood Center of Illinois Organization to encourage college students to support and participate in blood donations. The long-term well-being of the local community and wherever our alumni go can be supported by college students becoming habitual donors today. As an organization, our major goal is to be the student leaders facilitating this process and partnership between the local blood bank and the University of Illinois. Along the way, the organization strives to provide members with leadership opportunities through education, advocacy work, valuable communication experience, and most of all, a supportive community.

title: Book Nook
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The purpose of Book Nook at UIUC is to foster a love for fiction reading, providing students with an escape into new worlds and experiences through literature. Our goal is to create a welcoming space where members can immerse themselves in storytelling, find solace in fiction amidst their busy college lives, and share their perspectives on the books they explore.
membership_benefits:
1. Access to monthly book picks, voting, and discussions
2. Participation in exclusive book-related discussions and events
3. Opportunities to engage in book swaps and literary activities
4. Eligibility for leadership positions within the club

title: Brain Matters
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, Media Arts, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission: Brain Matters explores topics in neuroscience, psychology, and biology, featuring contributions from various authors affiliated with UIUC, including those from diverse fields like computer science and engineering. By embracing authors from all areas of study and academic levels, the journal boasts a rich collection of articles. While primarily tailored for the college community, Brain Matters is available to everyone as an Open Access Journal, thanks to the University Library. Our aim is to cultivate an inclusive and inviting scientific environment on campus.
membership_benefits: As a general member of Brain Matters, you can engage in social events, neuroscience discussions, and mentorship programs to foster professional development. In addition, you can participate in workshops and community outreach initiatives. As a writer, you can gain recognition through your own publications and benefit from access to a journal dedicated to your own research. Join us in cultivating an inclusive and vibrant scientific environment on campus and beyond for all things neuroscience!

title: Brave New Midnight
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: Brave New Midnight will serve as a recreational club for people to play the World of Darkness: Vampire the Masquerade system.

title: Break Point Step Team at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: At Break Point, we move with purpose, step with passion, and set fire to the floor with energy. We aim to embody power, pride, and precision. We welcome all who bring creativity and heart to the art of stepping.
membership_benefits:
Membership Benefits- Members of CODE RED will have the following benefits within the organization:
Voting Rights
Ability to travel with CODE RED
Free admission to CODE RED events
Perform at major campus events and showcases
Leadership opportunities- Chance to become a captain, choreographer, or officer

title: Bridges International
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture
mission:
Bridges International is a student organization that engages with international students through providing service activities, social networking, spiritual conversations, and student leadership development.
Bridges International is a caring community of Christ-followers committed to serve, promote social connections and engage in spiritual conversations with international students so that students become leaders internationally.
As a Christian organization, open to students from all religious backgrounds, it is our purpose to develop a diverse and caring community that serves the unique needs of international students while creating a safe space for those interested to explore faith and life, especially as they are seen through the perspective of Christianity and the Bible. For any who embrace the Christian faith, we encourage them to grow in faith and to thoughtfully and respectfully express their faith
in a manner that serves and engages the UIUC community, Champaign-Urbana, and the world.

title: Bringing Individuals Together to Eat
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure
mission: Bringing Individuals Together to Eat serves to provide students with the opportunity to give back to the community by cooking and donating the food we make to local food pantries. Our main mission will be to partner with local restaurants and food kitchens to get involved philanthropically with the local community and give back via food.

title: Bucket Golf Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The Bucket Golf Illini serves as a fun outdoor game open to all students and focuses on the game bucket golf. Bucket golf is a portable golf course that uses wiffle balls and plastic clubs. This is great for students who have a passion for golf and/or outdoor games and do not have access to them at college. No prior experience is necessary!

title: BuildIllinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: We're the largest community of founders, builders, researchers, and creatives on campus, and we help you bring your ideas to life through hackathons, lightning talks, trips to Chicago/San Francisco, and access to our world-class network.

title: Building Research Insights and Developing General Education
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Information & Data Sciences, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission: BRIDGE is an organization that serves to combat health and academic illiteracy and misinformation through student-led initiatives. These programs aim to increase the public’s awareness on the processes that lead to discoveries in the research the institution of UIUC conducts every day. BRIDGE also acts as a liaison between labs, students, and the general public in efforts that will allow undergraduate students to find research assistant openings within on-campus labs and graduate student to find prospective participants for their research within the community.

title: Bus Club
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: Bus Club serves to help interested students ride every Champaign-Urbana Mass Transit District bus route offered for the service year. In the process of completing this goal, Bus Club serves as an approachable way for students to learn how and why to use transit and as an introduction to the broader world of the Champaign and Urbana off campus.

title: Business Council
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: Business Council is a professional business organization that helps its members achieve their goals and build a lifetime network of some of the most accomplished, driven students on the University of Illinois campus. This is accomplished through events planned and executed by our Leadership Team and centered around our three fundamental organizational pillars: Professional, Service, and Social.
membership_benefits: Members of Business Council have access to professional, social, and service events, allowing them to tap into a lucrative network of active members and alumni as they continue on their journey through college.

title: C-U Cinefile
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: The C-U Cinefile supports the intellectual exploration of and engagement with film as a medium, both for students pursuing film studies in higher education and for those looking to deepen their understanding outside of casual film viewings.

title: Calisthenics Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission: The UIUC Calisthenics Club serves to provide a community for calisthenics enthusiasts, where everyone is welcome, friendly, and supportive. Whether members are beginners, intermediate, or advanced in the amazing art of calisthenics, this club will help everyone reach their calisthenics goals.

title: Camp Kesem at University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: The purpose of Camp Kesem is to provide leadership and volunteer opportunities for the students of University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign while serving the central Illinois community and greater metropolitan area. Camp Kesem recognizes and embraces the often-overlooked population of children affected by a parent’s cancer. A one-week long summer camp will be organized each year for children six to eighteen years old whose parent or primary caregiver has had or currently have cancer. No other type of child may participate in the camp. Camp Kesem will be a place where these children can experience the simple joys of childhood and relate to other children in similar situations. Student leaders of Camp Kesem will organize all aspects of the camp and fundraise enough money for every child who attends the camp to do so for free.

title: Campus Sanskrit Network
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture
mission: The Campus Sanskrit Network serves to promote Sanskrit, the ancient language of South Asia, as an everyday language and provide access to its rich and diverse repository of knowledge. We teach classes weekly on spoken Sanskrit at various levels and literary texts pertaining to philosophy and ethics. We also conduct various cultural events to help foster community and connection to Indic culture.
membership_benefits: Access to weekly classes in multiple levels of Sanskrit language and literature, cultural events, and performances.

title: Cancer Center at Illinois Student Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, Health & Human Sciences
mission: Our organization hopes to be a bridge between undergraduate students and cancer researchers at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, with this goal in mind we hope to 1) Communicate the ongoing advancements in cancer research 2) Connect undergraduates with research laboratories. In addition, we are working as a team of different committees to conduct mentor/mentee events, research seminars, restaurant/bake-sale fundraisers to help support the mission of Cancer Center at Illinois on campus.

title: Cancer Health Advocacy, Research, and Mentorship at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission:
The Cancer Health Advocacy, Research, and Mentorship at UIUC serves as an
awareness and resources based RSO, our mission is to empower the next generation of healthcare professionals by fostering a supportive community dedicated to cancer awareness, advocacy, and scientific research. We strive to bridge the gap between students and impactful opportunities in healthcare, such as offering mentorship, volunteering, and valuable experiences to enhance each member’s journey toward their career. Through educational initiatives, hands-on
experiences, and a commitment to service, CHARM is dedicated to promoting cancer awareness, advancing research, and inspiring compassionate individuals in health care.
membership_benefits:
Members of CHARM will have the following benefits within the organization:
1. Mentorship Opportunities as they wish to participate in to receive guidance, resources, and advice on academic and career paths within healthcare
2. Professional Development through workshops, seminars, and guest speakers
3. Exposure to research and volunteer experiences
4. Networking opportunities and a supportive community within the body of the organization

title: Cardistry at Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: Cardistry at Illini serves as to create a welcoming, collaborative, and creative space where students can learn, practice, and advance the art of cardistry. Our purpose is to provide a dedicated space for skill development for members of any skill range, bridging the gap between physical dexterity and modern digital expression. Members are empowered to master the craft of card flourishing and explore its potential through videography, creating a unique platform to share their creativity and build a supportive community that celebrates both the performance and the art of capturing it.

title: Caring Companions Initiative
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: The Organization is established for the purpose of serving individuals living in assisted living facilities, nursing facilities, and other types of senior living facilities and retirement homes.

title: Catholic Illini Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality, International, Social & Leisure
mission: To create a sense of unity among Catholic Illini and to outreach to the general campus as well.

title: Catholic Relief Services at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization

mission:

title: Chi Epsilon Civil Engineering Honor Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Honorary, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
Chi Epsilon (XE) is the National Civil Engineering Honor Society in the United States, dedicated to recognizing students who embody the principles of scholarship, character, practicality, and sociability in the civil engineering profession. Founded on May 20, 1922, at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, it emerged from the efforts of two groups of civil engineering students who independently petitioned to establish an honorary fraternity. Since then, Chi Epsilon has grown to 147 chapters nationwide, with over 125,000 initiated members.
The University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign chapter, known as the Alpha Chapter, provides a platform for members to engage deeply with both academic and industry facets of civil engineering. The chapter emphasizes a balance between professional development opportunities and social activities, fostering a community of like-minded individuals. Membership is extended each semester to students with junior and senior standing in the top third of their class, as well as to all graduate students.

For example, accounting students run audits; psychology students work on organizational culture, social work plans attractive activities, etc. Also, we would like to share information on what business clubs and entertainment clubs to join, helping them at their convenience, like providing group chat about rides and used items, etc., especially for Chinese students to be better involved in this school. Students of other ethnicities are also welcome; they can have a perfect opportunity to study and practice Chinese. There would be certain openings in law and theater groups preferring real top students. We would also provide Chinese corners to help students at UIUC learn more about Chinese culture.

title: Chinese Football Association
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission:
Mission Statement:
The Chinese Football Association (CFA) is dedicated to fostering a passion for soccer among Chinese students and the broader campus community. Our mission is to:
Promote Soccer: Increase awareness and participation in soccer by organizing regular training sessions, matches, and tournaments for students of all skill levels.
Cultural Exchange: Serve as a platform for cultural exchange through soccer, bringing together students from diverse backgrounds to share their love for the sport and learn from one another.
Skill Development: Provide opportunities for members to improve their soccer skills through coaching, workshops, and collaborative learning experiences.
Community Building: Create a strong, inclusive community that supports teamwork, sportsmanship, and mutual respect on and off the field.
Leadership and Growth: Develop leadership and organizational skills among members by involving them in the planning and execution of club activities and events.
Representation and Pride: Represent the Chinese student community in intercollegiate and local competitions, fostering pride and unity through competitive and friendly matches.
Health and Wellness: Promote physical fitness, mental well-being, and a healthy lifestyle through regular soccer activities and education on the benefits of sports.

Through wonderful spiritual work, vision, and different interpretations of the Bible, club members will not only further understand the scripture, but also earn both personal and corporate experience of the word of God through reading their paragon of life and faith.
Our club offers:

title: Clubs Communities
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Social & Leisure
mission: “To support all students in finding and fostering their community—because we need each other.”
membership_benefits:
COMMUNITY: HEARTS
Our Community Pillar strives to be a welcoming and inviting space where people can belong, or feel comfortable enough to let us help them get connected into another org/RSO/community fit for them. This pillar is important because people should be able to access a sense of community without having to fully commit themselves, or fill in some niche interest, or go through interviews; without having to go through trials or barriers—physical, mental, social, or otherwise.
The community pillars would act as a general assembly and be provided regular meetings and activities by our Committee and Creator pillars.
COMMITTEE: DIAMONDS
The Committee pillar is our way to find and attract capable individuals or teams to direct meetings, plan events, and help them grow through experiential leadership. We would either outsource talent or internally recruit people to fill in needed positions for different communities blossoming within the club. As a community, we want our members, but also the university as a whole, to be able to use their skills and have the opportunity to flourish as much as they are willing to.
The Committee Pillar would work in tandem with either the Creators or the Executive Board of Clubs Communities to create
CREATION: SPADES
The Creators Pillar contains individuals or groups who feel there is something missing here at U of I. This pillar will work to naturally create and form needed communities here on campus, filling voids with RSO’s, Culture, and Opportunities to connect and belong.

title: College of Law Labor and Employment Law Society at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Law
mission:
The first major purpose this organization will serve shall be to inform and educate students at the College of Law about both the fields of labor & employment law, provide networking opportunities for students, and offer perspectives on the major career opportunities in these fields. This shall be done through, but will not be limited to, informational meetings and seminars involving guest speakers within the fields of labor & employment law.
ii.) The other major purpose this organization will serve will be to promote working-class solidarity within the Champaign-Urbana community and beyond. Our aim shall be to promote collective bargaining by supporting organized workers and workers seeking union recognition. Further, we shall stand against the unjust practices of employment discrimination, wage theft, and workplace abuse. These goals may be pursued through direct action, such as mutual aid, protest, and advocacy, or by way of promoting changes in public policy.
