mission: The Jewelry Crafting Community serves to create a comfortable space for students to craft jewelry and express themselves using the various materials in the form of jewelry. Our members can create jewelry pieces to enhance their style as accessories or have this hobby for fun. Jewelry Crafting Community wants to create a community to promote the niche craft of jewelry-making. JCC members will also learn how affordable it is crafting pieces themselves, gaining beneficial experience and having a community to be a part of.

title: Jewish Law Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture, Law
mission: To allow all College of Law students to give tzedakah, engage in meaningful conversations about Judaism, and open networking and other opportunities through the Jewish faith.

title: Journey International Ministry
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission:
We’re a group of international and local students with diverse backgrounds. We meet weekly to serve our community, navigate college life together, and explore the Bible!
We think college is the perfect time to ask questions like, "Does God exist?" and “What’s my life about?” Here, we ask questions, seek answers, and build friendships and memories along the way. Whether or not you identify as a Christian, you’re invited to join our home away from home.
membership_benefits: We meet every Friday night and Sunday afternoon, with meals/light refreshments and rides provided! (See Forum for more details)

title: Justice Under Restorative Youth
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Law
mission: The Justice Under Restorative Youth serves to establish a sustainable, student-led organization at UIUC that not only participates in restorative justice through Peer Court, but also uplifts and advocates for youth through outreach and policy initiatives. This will create a unique model of community engagement driven by college students, empowering both us and the youth we serve.
membership_benefits:
1. Voting Rights – Members may vote on organizational decisions, elections, and other
matters requiring member input.
2. Ability to Travel with the Organization – Members may participate in approved travel
opportunities related to organizational activities and events.
3. Free Admission to Events – Members shall receive complimentary access to events
hosted by the organization.
4. Eligibility to Run for Officer Roles – Members in good standing may apply or run for
subcommittee or Executive Board positions.
5. Professional Development Opportunities – Access to workshops, training sessions, and
skill-building experiences relevant to restorative justice, leadership, and community
engagement.
6. Networking Opportunities – Connection with peers, school staff, and community
partners involved in restorative justice initiatives.
7. Leadership Experience – Opportunities to serve in subcommittee or project leadership
roles, even if not on the Executive Board.
8. Participation in Hearings and Peer Court Cases – Hands-on experience in facilitating,
judging, or consulting in peer court cases.
9. Access to Organizational Resources – Use of materials, templates, and guides
developed by the organization for projects, outreach, or hearings.

title: Kappa Kappa Psi
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Honorary, Performance Arts
mission:
Section 1. Local Purposes. This Chapter has been established to provide service and assistance to the University of Illinois Band Program.
Section 2. National Purposes. This Chapter will also operate in accordance to the national Purposes located in the Preamble of the National Constitution which are as follows:
a) To promote the existence and welfare of the college and university bands and to cultivate at large a wholesome respect for their activities and achievements.
b) To honor outstanding band members through the privilege of membership extended as a reward for technical achievement and appreciation for the best in music.
c) To stimulate campus leadership and promulgate an uncompromising respect through the medium of the college band for gracious conduct, good taste and unswerving loyalty.
d) To foster a close relationship between college bands and promote a high average of attainment by the performance of good music and selection of worthwhile projects.
e) To provide a pleasant and helpful social experience for all engaged in college band work and to cooperate with other musical organizations in any manner consistent with the purposes of the institution at which are chapters located.

title: Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc.

Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture
mission: We, the Sisters of Kappa Phi Gamma Sorority, Inc., shall create a Sisterhood directed towards the advancement of women. Kappa Phi Gamma aims to instill integrity of character and trust as components of personality. The Sorority shall encourage bonding of women in order to strengthen Sisterhood. We shall render service to the community and the university, thus supporting the betterment and unification of society. The Sisterhood shall develop leadership skills and high academic standards that follow into the professional world. Kappa Phi Gamma shall promote pride of culture, womanhood, and self.

title: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization

mission: Kappa Phi Lambda Sorority has formed to increase options for the diverse student body of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Our Sorority was established in the Spring of 1995 to pursue cultural awareness. In the midst of multiculturalism, we are here to continue the pursuit for unity and to bring forth the much-needed consciousness of “voices” that need to be heard.

title: Kappa Pi Beta National Fraternity, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: As a Brother of Kappa Pi Beta, I will strive hard to further the existence of this great fraternity. I will do my best to bring forth a bond of unity to all of my fellow Brothers that will stand the test of time. Along with the close relationships that are built, I pledge to promote academic excellence, brotherhood, cultural awareness, social mobility, philanthropy, gentlemen values, and respect towards the individual and community. Regardless of the letters I wear, what organizations I am in, or national origin, I will set the example that unity is the ultimate beginning of Brotherhood. I will use these attributes as development of my character and retain them even beyond my years of higher learning.

title: Kappa Sigma Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities, Veteran & Military Connected
mission: Kappa Sigma is a men’s college fraternity. Its goals are many, but all center on the promotion of friendship, loyalty, and brotherly feeling. The objective of this organization is to excel in all phases of Fraternity and student activity at The University of Illinois. To fulfill this objective, the development of scholarship, leadership, community service, social graces, and cultural awareness are encouraged and stressed. One step to achieving the status of a Kappa Sigma is to be a worldly gentleman. It is each member’s duty to work diligently toward these objectives so that few may equal, and none excel the ideal virtue of a true Kappa Sigma.
membership_benefits: Networking, Time-management, Community Service and Philanthropy, Leadership Development, Social Life

mission: The Kinesiology Student Association (KSA) at the University of Illinois is dedicated to enriching the academic and personal journey of students pursuing careers in the health sciences. Through engaging community service, dynamic social events, and campus-wide health promotion, we create opportunities for students to connect, grow, and thrive. KSA empowers members to explore diverse career paths, build lasting relationships, and contribute meaningfully to a vibrant and supportive kinesiology community.
membership_benefits: As a member of KSA at the University of Illinois, you’ll gain access to professional development events, hands-on volunteer opportunities, and a supportive network of peers who share your passion for health and movement. Enjoy socials, career panels, leadership opportunities, and exclusive resources like internship leads and resume workshops. Whether you're looking to build connections, grow as a leader, or explore your career path, KSA offers a fun and enriching way to get involved in the kinesiology community.

title: Korean Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, International, Social & Leisure
mission:
Korean Student Association is dedicated to make a difference in the Urbana-Champaign community. Our mission is to help Korean students achieve their goals during college years and beyond. We do so by hosting career fairs and providing them with opportunities such as volunteer work or language and cultural diffusion to become active members of the society. We also provide sports and social events for them to enhance interaction
with other Korean and non-Korean students. By introducing Korean culture to domestic students, we hope to familiarize domestic students to the culture and to encourage them to become the leaders of the globalized and diversified society.

title: Korean Undergraduate Network
tags:

mission:
The UIUC Korean Undergraduate Network (KUNet) aims to strengthen the
sense of community among Korean students by providing easily accessible and relevant information tailored to the college experience of international students. By leveraging social media platforms, KUNet focuses on sharing helpful tips, resources, and insights through engaging video content and posts. Our goal is to simplify the transition to university life by creating a dynamic and connected online presence that allows students to learn from each other, stay informed, and feel supported throughout their academic journey.

title: La Agencia

mission: La Agencia is a student-led alliance dedicated to cultivating Latino talent and amplifying our cultural voice across industries. While our roots are in advertising, marketing, and media, we proudly welcome and support Latino students from all majors. This RSO exists to equip Latino students with the tools, confidence, and community to lead and thrive in their chosen fields, while shaping inclusive narratives that reflect the richness of our identities.

title: La Colectiva

mission: La Colectiva is an advocacy and activism organization that promotes the awareness and inclusion of Latine social and cultural issues. We strive to provide our community with the tools and resources required to develop our consciousness in order to empower our people and all other communities facing similar forces of oppression. We hope to accomplish this by, creating a space that represents and celebrates people of color on the UIUC campus and beyond.

title: La Fuerza Flamenca

mission: La Fuerza Flamenca UIUC serves to create a dance community where individuals can create, explore, and express themselves through flamenco dance, a highly expressive Spanish dance style. LFF is a dance group dedicated to sharing the art of flamenco dance with the UIUC community. In a celebration of all individuals and their unique backgrounds, LFF creates art through classical flamenco dance while fusing other forms and dance styles into choreography. LFF will perform flamenco fusion dance.

title: LAS Leaders

mission:
The purpose of the LAS LEADERS shall be:
a. To serve as ambassadors for the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences to alumni, faculty, and students.
b. To promote the name and reputation of the University of Illinois College of Liberal Arts and Sciences to alumni, faculty, and students.
c. To set goals and plans for advancing the student body of the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences and the University of Illinois.
d. To foster standards of excellence within the group and its members.
e. To provide leadership experiences to all members.
f. To serve as a liaison between students, alumni, faculty and staff.
g. To provide professional and career development experience.
membership_benefits: As a member of LAS LEADERS, you will serve as a LEADER, promoting the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences (LAS) to alumni, faculty, and students, enhancing the university's reputation. You will have the opportunity to contribute to setting goals and advancing the student body while fostering high standards of excellence within the group. Membership offers valuable leadership experiences, acting as a liaison between students, alumni, faculty, and staff, and providing extensive professional and career development opportunities. Through these roles, you will build strong connections and gain skills that will benefit your personal and professional growth.

title: Latinx in Law

Through various events, workshops, and meetings, we aim to equip our members with the necessary tools to succeed in law school and beyond. We recognize the underrepresentation of Latinos in the legal profession and seek to show that there is a place for our community in this field. Our mission is to empower and guide each other to achieve success and make a meaningful impact in the legal industry. By offering a supportive network of like-minded individuals, we strive to create a community where members can flourish.

mission: The first major purpose this organization is to inform and educate students at the College of Law about the field of Artificial Intelligence (“AI”), and AI related governance, privacy, regulations, ethical, intellectual property, and other related issues. This shall be done through, but will not be limited to, informational meetings and seminars involving guest speakers within the field of Artificial Intelligence, regulatory bodies (NIST, Council on AI Governance, etc.), legal academia, computer science, and other disciplines. The other major purpose is to promote AI literacy in the student population, to support responsible and ethical use of AI, and propel the University of Illinois to prepare the next generation of AI-competent lawyers.

tags:

mission: The Leaders in Secondary Education serves as a means for students in Secondary Education, and students who aspire to be in secondary education to connect with current teachers and former students, network with fellow education focused students, recruit more students to join secondary education, and learn from a growing community of current educators and department leaders.
membership_benefits:
-Access to network of student/teachers
-Build an inclusive community with other aspiring secondary education

B. To provide fellowship among students interested in the academic study of language.
C. To represent undergraduate student needs and wants in regard to their academics administered by the Department of Linguistics at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

tags:

mission: LSA is a student-led organization that aims to support and strengthen the bonds amongst prospective, currently enrolled and past Lebanese UIUC students. It also aims to spread awareness about the Lebanese identity and culture as part of UIUC’s student body.

title: Leetcode Club UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Information & Data Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Leetcode Club UIUC empowers students to confidently approach technical interviews by building problem-solving skills and practical knowledge essential for the industry. We create a supportive community where underclassmen can explore applications of classroom concepts, while upperclassmen provide mentorship, technical insights, and behavioral guidance while building on their own skills. Our focus is on consistent, purposeful practice with Leetcode problems and mutual encouragement, ensuring every member is well-prepared for the industry recruiting process.

title: Left Wing Students for Change
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Ideology & Politics
mission: Left Wing Students for Change serves as a way for Students to get involved in shaping their communities. This RSO focuses on five main pillars, with all of them playing an integral role. The 1st is to help elect Progressives into all levels of office. The second is to help Champaign-Urbana directly with volunteering and charity. Third, to prepare students for careers in politics through providing access for internships, networking, and resume building. Fourth is to meet like minded students and build community through social events. Fifth is to advocate for progressive policies on campus and in Champaign-Urbana. Join to organize, serve, and grow: organize for progressive candidates, serve our local community, and grow your career through hands-on training and networking.
membership_benefits:
Voting Rights for RSO elections and endorsement voting
Ability to travel with RSO
Free admission to RSO events
Eligibility to run for officer roles
Having access to exclusive internships and networking opportunities
Having admission into social events put on by the RSO

title: Legend Dance Company
tags:

mission: The purpose of Legend Dance Company is to provide the students of the University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign with an opportunity to seriously dance and choreograph on a team in a non competitive atmosphere. In addition to that, we will develop repertoire that will be performed in a show during spring semester of every year.

title: Life-Line Bridge Foundation
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: The Life-Line Bridge Foundation serves to mobilize students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign to take action against poverty and humanitarian crises by fundraising, organizing awareness campaigns, and supporting both local and global communities in need. We aim to bridge the gap between resources and underserved populations by promoting empathy, service, and equity.

title: Limitless Achievers
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - International, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The UIUC Limitless Achievers serves as the platform for students who have the ambition to challenge all sorts of world records. The RSO encourages students with the most creative and limitless minds to join and achieve things that seem impossible by many others. This will be a project based RSO. By the end of a project, members will have the chance to propose a new project, specifically about attempting to break a new record. Once the proposal is selected by the executive board, the proposer would then become the project leader until the end of the project term.

title: LinguaMed

mission: LinguaMed serves to provide students with an opportunity to be directly involved in learning linguistic aspects of medicine to enhance holistic care skills and raise funds for clinics struggling with medical terminology in second languages for translators

mission: Our mission is to foster community among linguistics graduate students as well as to provide platforms to improve professional skills and conduct and present research in linguistics and related fields.

title: Liquid Rocketry at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The Mission of Liquid Rocketry Illinois is to design, simulate, build, test and launch components of and an actual actively 3-axis controlled, pump-fed, liquid propellent rocket. We aim to do this through participation in collegiate rocketry competitions and safely operating rocket components.
membership_benefits: Members of Liquid Rocketry at Illinois have the opportunity to participate in collegiate rocketry competitions and attend aerospace conferences. We also provide hands on experience in the design, simulation, building, testing and launching of industry standard technologies relating to liquid rockets.

title: Love + Flour Baking Club
tags:

mission: The mission of the Love + Flour Baking Club is to provide a welcoming and inclusive community for individuals who share a passion for baking. The Club aims to promote the joy of baking, enhance culinary skills, and foster a sense of camaraderie among its members. Through regular meetings, activities, and events, we aim to explore various baking techniques, recipes, and cultures while spreading the love of baking to our local community.

mission: The RSO aims to educate students on how to look at the capital markets on a macro perspective. We will educate and train students in knowledge of asset and sector allocation. We will focus mainly on fixed income, commodities and currencies education. We believe there is a big market in the space of macro assets of fixed income, commodities and currencies but there is resources for students to gain education in that space.

Attend Weekly Lectures
Networking Events

This group will not only teach students how to make colorful keychains and beautiful bouquets but also teach about cultures from different parts of the world by making out things in their culture. Finally, we will introduce the effect of materials and techniques on the DIY works.

title: Maker Network
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Maker Network is a student-led organization that strives to connect maker spaces, fabrication shops, studios, and creative students across the UIUC campus, empower and inform members of the campus community by centralizing information about on-campus resources, and develop and facilitate collaborative, community-oriented initiatives between student organizations and campus units to support UIUC’s community of makers.

title: makesmewanna art collective
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Environmental & Sustainability, Media Arts, Performance Arts
mission: makesmewanna was created by a group of students who wanted a platform to disseminate their art into the broader community. As we’re all nearing graduation, we need a place to experiment and find ourselves as artists. We’re interested in building symbiotic relationships with the people around us so as much as they are informed by our work, we are informed by their energy. Ultimately, our goal is to make connections with our work outside of academia to knit together the University and the broader CU community through the arts. Our hope is that people can begin to view art as another vector of change. In other words, we want to put art into it: the convention, the conversation, and the community.

title: Malaysian Student Association (MaSA)
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission:
Section 1. To ensure the well-being of Malaysians and create a sense of identity for Malaysians here on campus through holding —
Social or cultural events.
Professional development initiatives.
Mental health interventions.
Section 2. To preserve the unique culture of Malaysia and educate the campus community about the cultures and celebrations of Malaysia.
Section 3. To act as a medium in promoting the University to other Malaysians.
membership_benefits: Becoming a member of our MaSA means joining a supportive community of Malaysians on campus and beyond. You'll have the chance to build meaningful connections with fellow students, network with Malaysian communities across the United States, and celebrate our culture through fun and engaging events. Members enjoy free food at social gatherings, access to exclusive cultural programs, and the opportunity to foster a strong sense of identity and belonging. Whether you're looking to make new friends, reconnect with your roots, or simply find your home away from home, our organization is here for you.

title: MannMukti
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: MannMukti is an organization that aims to encourage healthy, open dialogue of mental health issues in the South Asian community in an effort to remove stigma, improve awareness and promote self-care. All events and social posts by MannMukti will be delivered to this mission.

title: Mariachi Alma de la Universidad de Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: We are Mariachi Alma de la Universidad de Illinois, a vibrant ensemble rooted in the heart of La Casa Cultural Latina at UIUC. As a collective, we are deeply passionate about preserving and promoting traditional Mariachi music, celebrating its rich cultural heritage, and the profound ways it nourishes our almas. We serve to play this genre of music to the CU community, representing the University with pride in our institution and our culture.

title: Master of Finance Student Organization
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission:
The Master of Finance Student Organization connects students with industry
professionals through networking events, guest speakers, and industry tours, offering valuable
insights into financial markets. Members also have the opportunity to build essential career
skills, including logical thinking, management decision-making, and negotiation. Together, these
experiences prepare students to excel in their professional journeys while fostering meaningful
industry connections.

title: Material Advantage
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: To serve students interested in materials science by keeping the student body informed of the opportunities available within the field of Materials Science, serve as liaisons between the student body and faculty, and to build a supportive community that promotes the growth of friendships and connections within the MatSE program, between other student organizations, and within the larger community.

title: Materials Research Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Materials Research Society (MRS) is a graduate student organization of materials researchers from academia, industry, and government that promotes communication for the advancement of interdisciplinary materials research to improve the quality of life. The goal of MRS is to support MatSE graduate students in their academic endeavors through social and professional initiatives. MRS will foster an amicable and open environment in which grad students feel safe to share ideas and are supported by their fellow peers.

title: MCB Philanthropy
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission: The MCB Philanthropy RSO is an organization dedicated to providing Molecular and Cellular Biology students at the University of Illinois opportunities to aid local non-profit organizations through financial contributions. MCB Philanthropy aims to increase student involvement and awareness about local non-profit causes through semi-annual fundraising events.

title: Medicine4Youth @ UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Health & Human Sciences
mission: Medicine4Youth at UIUC aims to bridge the gap between medicine and community accessibility by empowering college students to translate complex medical concepts into engaging, age-appropriate education for younger generations. Through youth-focused outreach, educational innovation, and public health communication, the chapter strives to cultivate the next generation’s curiosity for medicine while developing UIUC students into compassionate and socially aware future healthcare leaders.

title: MedicZero
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Human Sciences
mission: The purpose of MedicZero is to enable bystanders with the confidence to recognize emergencies and initiate care, encouraging the delivery of skillful, evidence-based care by providers, and constructing community paramedicine initiatives to improve the prehospital landscape.

title: MedLaunch
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The mission of MedLaunch is to foster an environment where students from all disciplines can come together with the CU disability community to design, develop, and deliver projects that allow community members to overcome some barrier to accessibility. MedLaunch combines innovation with human centered design and disability advocacy to create a collaborative environment for students to work on meaningful projects and learn new skills.

title: MEDLIFE UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission:
MEDLIFE UIUC, a chapter of MEDLIFE International serving the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign community, is committed to creating and providing sustainable medical, educational, and infrastructural support to empower low-income communities at home in Urbana-Champaign and abroad. This organization accomplishes its mission by engaging students of all socioeconomic backgrounds in the opportunity to travel on MEDLIFE international mobile clinics, volunteer in
local projects, and fundraise for local and international projects to serve low-income families. This organization is committed to empowering its members in their service journey through its volunteer projects, educational discussions at general body meetings, as well as a considerable amount of leadership activities open to members of all grade levels.

title: Menace Ultimate Frisbee
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Club Sports
mission:
The purpose of this team is to grow the sport of ultimate within the community while developing each player on the team to the best of their ability. One of the
important goals for this team is to maintain participation and dedication in order to compete at the college level. While winning is not an end in itself, we believe that our players’ efforts to be their best will lead this team to succeed at the competitive level. We expect all players to respect themselves and others, demonstrate loyalty, be good teammates, handle failure like they handle success, have team spirit, have a strong work ethic, and show up and be prepared.

title: Mexican Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Mexican Student Association serves to foster dialogue and proactive engagement on political, social, and economic structures that influence both the Mexican community at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign’s and the broader society. Our mission is to promote and celebrate the rich heritage of Mexican culture through the organization of events and activities that reflect authentic traditions. Additionally, we are committed to supporting students pursuing higher education to enhance the well-being of the Latino community.

title: Mi Pueblo Spanish Conversation Groups
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International
mission: Mi Pueblo is a student-run language network created to provide informal opportunities to practice conversational Spanish on campus. Student facilitators arrange and maintain weekly, 1-hour meetings with other students to talk about various topics in Spanish. Through these meetings and participation in cultural events and activities, our goal is to improve participants’ Spanish speaking abilities as well as foster genuine social bonds between members of Mi Pueblo conversation groups and the Latinx and Spanish-speaking communities.

title: Microfishing at Illinois
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: Small fish matter - Microfishing at Illinois introduces people to the sport of catching small and unique fish from all over the midwest.

title: Mimosa Dance Crew
tags:

mission: Our mission is to showcase the diversity and creativity of the dance culture through performances that entertain and inspire. Through our passion for dance, we aim to promote cultural exchange and build meaningful connections within our community.

title: Mind, Body, and Soul
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The purpose of the Mind, Body, and Soul organization is to serve as a space where college students are given a chance to relax the mind, body, and soul. It is to allow for serenity, an RSO that offers students an opportunity to tend to their mental health using the promotion of peace and positivity.

title: Minorities in Aerospace

mission: MAero serves to provide a welcoming community and advocate for all marginalized groups including LGBTQ+, disabled people, first-gen students, religious minorities, and women within the Aerospace Engineering Department.

title: Minorities in Agriculture, Natural Resources and Related Sciences

mission: The mission of MANRRS-UIUC is to promote academic and professional excellence in students of diverse backgrounds within the fields of agriculture, natural resources, and related sciences.
membership_benefits: MANRRS-UIUC provides undergraduates and graduate students access to exclusive opportunities through our general assembly meetings, community service, and social events. Therefore, valuable skills and experiences are obtained by all MANRRS-UIUC members, leading them to being recognized on a MANRRS-National level. On a national level, MANRRS-UIUC connects students to conferences, scholarships, industry partners and more to prepare for successful careers within STEM, agriculture, natural resources, and related sciences.

title: Minorities in Animal Sciences
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural
mission: Minorities in Animal Sciences serves as a recognition for the unique academic and professional needs for underrepresented students in the department of Animal Sciences by providing community support/mentorship, professional development, and seminars specific to Animal Science careers. All students are welcome to join the organization.

title: Minorities in Public Health
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission: Educate and encourage minorities on campus who are interested in a career in the public health field
membership_benefits: Gives members the chance to learn about future opportunities within public health, and gain volunteer hours at some of our events.

title: Minorities in STEM
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural, Environmental & Sustainability, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, Life & Physical Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, Veterinary
mission: The Minorities in STEM will serve as a place for students to come together in support of each other, make friends with similar interests/future plans, and learn more about different careers in STEM. This RSO will be open to all students who are in a STEM major or are considering a STEM major but will be targeted towards minority students. Having one of the many majors that fall under STEM is difficult as is and sometimes by simply being a minority makes it even more difficult on students. Minorities in STEM will allow undergraduates to speak openly about their struggles, find ways to seek academic help (whether it be through finding a tutor or through creating study groups), and learn new skills through the workshops that will be hosted. Another goal of this RSO is to provide students with different volunteer opportunities by reaching out to local organizations and in the community.

title: Minority Association for Future Attorneys
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The Minority Association of Future Attorneys (MAFA) was founded to assist minority pre-law students in their journey to law school and to becoming successful attorneys.

title: Minority Association of Pre-Dental Students
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness
mission: Joining the Minority Association of Dental Students at UIUC offers a supportive community where members can connect over shared experiences, fostering a sense of belonging. Additionally, members gain access to cultural awareness initiatives and educational programs, empowering them to thrive academically while actively contributing to the advocacy and representation of minority students on campus.

title: Minority Association of Pre-Medical Students
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, Health & Human Sciences
mission:
Amongst many of the minority students on various campuses, there is a genuine belief
that there are many minority pre-health students on campuses who have the potential to one
day be vital parts of the medical field, but need additional support. As an
organization, there is the firm belief that with the guidance and resources that minority
students can receive from such an opportunity, the extensive process of becoming a
pre-health student can and will soon become a mere obstacle that will be overcome amongst
all minority students.

title: Minority Business Students Association
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: MBSA is a professional organization that is filled with ambitious individuals who strive for professionalism. Each member aspires to be the best version of themselves. MBSA provides unique experiences to each member. Our mission is to provide underrepresented students with both academic and career orientation while teaching each member the value of diversity they can bring. The basis of our campus involvement is based on three pillars: professional, philanthropy, and community.

title: Mixed Motions UIUC
tags:

mission: Mixed Motions UIUC serves as a dance performance group which aims to promote diversity through various styles of dance.

To advocate for the needs and issues facing Mixed students
To learn from each other about the multiplicity of experiences that exist within the mixed community
To collaborate with student organizations and campus partners to promote an inclusive and positive campus climate for Mixed students

title: Mo's Burritos Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: Mo’s Burritos Club (MBC) serves to provide a space in which University of Illinois Students can gather, enjoy, and appreciate Mo’s Burritos. MBC also serves to provide the infrastructure and food necessary to eat and enjoy Mo’s Burritos (and related) cuisine, including, but not necessarily limited to: Mo’s Burritos menu items, menu items of comparable/similar Mexican restaurants, menu items of different cuisines and restaurants, etc. This vast array of different menu selections enables MBC to highlight the elite nature of Mo’s Burritos menu offerings, which will be done through a variety of different programming opportunities such as tastings, samplings, dining experience assessments, etc.

title: Moda Belissima
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Performance Arts
mission: Moda B serves as a creative outlet for our members. Through our work, we envision our members will become bold leaders that use their unique creativity and perspective to make changes, for the better, in all areas of life and make it look good while doing it. The mission of the organization is to instill confidence, strength, technique, and high fashion through the power and presence of the model’s body.

title: Momentum Dance Collective
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Momentum Dance Collective serves as the pre-professional, audition-based dance organization at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. MDC provides a platform for dancers to refine their technique, explore multiple styles including contemporary, jazz, musical theater, and hip hop, and present high-quality performances for the campus community. The organization’s mission is to celebrate school spirit and artistic expression by performing at athletic events, student showcases, and two self-produced shows each academic year, while also pursuing opportunities for adjudicated performances, master workshops, guest choreography or competitions as resources allow.
membership_benefits:
Members of MDC will have the following benefits within the organization:
Being in a supportive company environment that fosters both artistic growth and personal connection throughout its members and the community.
Eligibility to perform in shows and at campus events.
Ability to propose choreography for consideration in showcases or performances.
Voting rights in organizational matters.
Eligibility to run for officer positions.

title: Mongolian Cultural Organization at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: Through campus involvement, our mission is to create meaningful experiences, a vibrant community, and lifelong memories for University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign students and community members. By introducing Mongolian culture, tradition, language, cuisine, and history to UIUC, we work towards promoting closer educational relations between the United States and Mongolia.

title: Montage Arts Journal
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: Founded in 2007, Montage Arts Journal is the undergraduate literary journal edited and designed by students at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Our goal is to publish the finest, freshest, most innovative work by talented UIUC students from all disciplines and backgrounds.

title: Mountain of Fire Campus Fellowship
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission:
Equipping the campus community with resources that help people find their
purpose, reach their goals and achieve full potential through physical, mental and spiritual empowerment.
membership_benefits: MFMCF UIUC provides excellent career counseling, professional development tools and networking opportunities for students and alumni in their pursuit of vocational callings. These varied objectives are met through professional mentoring, material support, spiritual counselling and technology support.

title: Mu Epsilon Delta
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission:
The purpose of Mu Epsilon Delta is three-fold:
To encourage excellence in health science scholarship by promoting a holistic model of healthcare by fostering cooperation and collaboration between various pre-health disciplines, educators, and professionals.
To establish brotherhood among students interested in similar career paths by enriching the student experience, bolstering professional networks, and inspiring personal growth.
To serve the local, national, and global communities by organizing fundraisers, engaging in volunteering, and advocating for people in need.
membership_benefits:
- tight-knit community of pre-health students
- academic support
- professional development opportunities
- social events
- leadership

title: Muay Thai Club at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Health & Wellness
mission: Our purpose is to provide a safe space for UIUC students to practice Muay Thai, and to build a community around the sport. We strive to advance the values of the martial arts. The practices we hold promote wellbeing, health and confidence in our members.

title: Music Education Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Performance Arts
mission:
Our community is united by our shared love for music, music education, and service. We offer both professional and social opportunities to aspiring music educators of all academic majors!
MESA, Music Education Student Association, was founded in 2022 at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Our goal is to serve our community by promoting our passion for music, music education, and service to our members by providing professional and social opportunities for future music educators!​ We serve as the local ILCMEA Student Chapter (Illinois Collegiate Music Education Association) as well as a NAfME Collegiate chapter of NAfME (National Association for Music Education).​

title: Music Teachers National Association UIUC Collegiate Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Performance Arts
mission:
MTNA UIUC Collegiate Chapter serves to foster a community of future
music educators who are committed to excellence in teaching and champion the mission of
the Music Teachers National Association. We aim to provide a collaborative platform for
members to share resources, exchange ideas, and develop their skills as music educators
through professional developments opportunities, mentorship, workshops, performances,
and outreach activities.

title: Musical Medics
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Performance Arts
mission: Musical Medics serves to provide a creative musical outlet for pre-health students while providing a positive experience and environment for inhabitants of various local healthcare facilities.

title: Muslim Law Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission:
The objectives of the Muslim Law Students Association will be to:
Represent the interests and the ideas of the Muslim law students at the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign.
Address the issues currently faced by the Muslim law students on campus and the issues of Muslim society in general.
Highlight the cultural and religious backgrounds of the Muslim law students on campus.

title: Muslim Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission:
The Muslim Students Association at the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign is a group of
Muslim students on campus who are dedicated to supporting one another and enriching our lives
through religious education, social justice activism, and community building. Our goal is to
create a welcoming and inclusive environment for all Muslim students at our university, while

strive to bring the teachings and values of Islam to the forefront of our community and share
them with the wider university body.

title: National Association of Black Journalists
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Media Arts
mission:
The purpose of the NABJ-UIUC shall be to bring about
a union of local Black journalists dedicated to truth and excellence
in the news, and full equality in the industry in order:
(a) To expand and balance the media’s coverage of the Black
community and Black experience.
(b) To encourage students to identify careers in journalism. (c) To
strengthen the ties between Blacks who work in majority-owned
media and Blacks who work in the Black-owned media. (d) To
sensitize the majority-owned media to racism. (e) To award
scholarships and internships to Black students. (f) To be an
exemplary group of professionals that honors excellence and
outstanding achievement among Black journalists. (g) To work
with high schools to identify potential Black journalists. (h) To
chronicle the history of Black journalists.
Section 2. NABJ-UIUC may, after approval of a majority of its
members, take positions or act on issues of social or professional
concern.

purposes including, making distributions to organizations that qualify as exempt
organizations under Section 501 (c) 3 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 (or
the corresponding provisions of any future United States Internal Revenue Law).
NACWC shall endeavor to: promote interracial understanding, justice and peace
among all people; raise the standard of the home and advance the moral,
economic, social and religious welfare of the family; promote the education of
women and girls through local, state and regional activities; and foster and protect
the constitutionally guaranteed civil rights for all people including the right of
women and children to work and obtain equal opportunity in all areas of
employment. The Women of Collegiate Chapter Name of National Association

community and any previously mentioned endeavors in the purpose.

The different types of supportive small groups we provide include a women’s group, youth group, bible studies, as well as separate undergraduate and graduate small groups. title: No Strings Attached A Cappella
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
At No Strings Attached A Cappella, our mission is to harmonize voices, captivate audiences, and create memorable musical experiences through the power of contemporary a cappella. We are dedicated to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and supportive community that celebrates the unique talents of each individual, while collectively striving for artistic excellence.
Through our dynamic performances, we aim to inspire and uplift audiences by delivering innovative arrangements in pop, jazz, and other contemporary genres. By pushing the boundaries of a cappella, we seek to captivate listeners with our creative interpretations, tight harmonies, and engaging stage presence.
We believe in the transformative power of music and the ability of a cappella to transcend cultural and linguistic barriers. As ambassadors of this vocal art form, we embrace collaboration, experimentation, and continuous growth, pushing ourselves to reach new heights of musicality.
Driven by passion, discipline, and a commitment to professionalism, we dedicate ourselves to regular rehearsals, focused training, and ongoing musical education. Our shared journey as a group fosters lasting friendships, personal growth, and the development of valuable skills in teamwork, communication, and artistic expression.
We actively engage with our local community and strive to make a positive impact through our performances and outreach initiatives. By sharing our love for a cappella, we aim to inspire others to discover their own voices, embrace their creativity, and explore the boundless possibilities of music.
Ultimately, our mission is to create unforgettable musical moments that resonate with audiences, leaving them inspired, uplifted, and connected through the universal language of a cappella harmony.

Our goals include organizing departmental social and professional events, like camping trips, trivia nights, and an annual research symposium. We also act as a liaison for communication between students and faculty by participating in and sharing information from faculty meetings.

mission: The Organization for Latines in Audiology and Speech-language pathology (OLAS) is an organization dedicated to the support and success of Latine students following the career path of Speech and Hearing Sciences (SHS), as well as to students interested in the field. We are advocating and empowering Latine students within a predominantly white field and institution. We ensure that our members feel confident and prepared when they graduate and join the field, in hopes of lowering the effects of imposter syndrome. To accomplish this, we offer our members with resources, social support, and opportunities for growth within the field. This would incorporate study sessions, discussions with certified SLPs and audiologists, overall check-ins with members, etc. In all, we hope to create a safe and inclusive environment that fosters a community for students with similar cultures within the field.

title: Orthodox Christian Fellowship
tags:

mission: The purpose of this organization is to support fellowships on college campuses, whose members experience and witness the Orthodox Christian Church through community life, prayer, service to others and study of the Faith. Our national headquarters is located in Indianapolis, IN and supports 270 local university chapters across the U.S. and Canada. In addition, they provide a variety of thoughtful and innovative programming, including regional training, annual conferences, and domestic and international service learning projects. Orthodox Christian Fellowship Illinois serves as a way to provide religious, social, and philanthropic activities to all University of Illinois students, faculty, and staff that are interested in the Orthodox Christian Faith.

title: Pakistani Graduate Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission:
The PGSA serves to provide a platform for representing the interests of Pakistani and Pakistan-origin graduate students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and supporting them in their endeavor to promote Pakistani culture and heritage within the larger Champaign-Urbana community. Through social, cultural and humanitarian-themed events and community gatherings, we hope to unite a larger community of students of all races, cultures, religions, and genders interested in learning more about Pakistan and dispel inaccurate and negative stereotypes.
The PGSA aims to hold numerous events throughout the academic year. These include but are not limited to charity events, picnics and cookouts, cricket tournaments and cultural performances in collaboration with other like-minded organizations on campus. We will also host informal gatherings such as ‘Chai Chaat’ for our members to engage in community-building over a cup of tea while discussing broader human rights and social justice issues. We hope to invite guest speakers with expertise on Pakistani society, politics and political economy, from leading research Universities around the country and across the world to engage in discussion on the pertinent issues facing Pakistan today.
In summary, the PGSA is committed to creating a welcoming and inclusive community for Pakistani and Pakistan-origin graduate students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign while also promoting Pakistani culture and heritage to a broader audience.

Our mission is to provide medical and humanitarian relief collectively and individually to children throughout the Levant, regardless of their nationality or religion. and best practices.

membership_benefits: Joining Phi Delta Epsilon will give members the resources to succeed as a pre-medical student. title: Phi Delta Phi - Illini Hall

title: Phi Delta Theta
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission:
The Brotherhood of the Illinois Eta Chapter of the Phi Delta Theta Fraternity has been established and shall continue in perpetuity to strive within our membership to achieve and maintain the following purposes.
Section 2. Friendship, Sound Learning, and Rectitude, being the three cardinal principles of our great Fraternity, we shall seek to forge between our members lasting relationships typified by the brotherly love, encouragement, and cooperation conducive to the inner health and well-being of the whole man. Also, we strive to create and maintain a physical setting which is conducive to study and intellectual growth. In addition, we strive to attain and uphold within our Chapter an environment of honour, respectability, and temperance.
Section 3. One of the foundational purposes of Illinois Eta is to offer beneficial guidance to its members in the latter stages of their growth towards mature adulthood. It is hoped that all of the members of this Chapter will walk away with a well developed sense of honour and personal responsibility consistent with Robert Morrison's guiding principle, "To do what ought to be done but what would not have been done unless I did it, I thought to be my duty."
Section 4. Illinois Eta seeks to promote within its members a sense of community interest
and activism. Through participation in service projects and other interactions with the local community and its representatives, it is believed that the members of the Chapter will come to recognize the non-material rewards such service brings as well as the enjoyment of work done not for personal gain.
Section 5. As it is recognized that the health of the Greek system nationally and on campus has a significant effect on our Fraternity and our Chapter, Illinois Eta encourages its members to make positive contributions to inter-Greek relations and to work together with other fraternities and sororities in unity to present the community (locally and nationally) with a benevolent public image that the Greek system may be seen as an asset to the community.

tags:

title: Phi Sigma Sigma
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Cultivate relationships, secure and provide financial resources for Phi Sigma Sigma sisters to achieve excellence, impact their communities, and change the world.
membership_benefits:
Sisterhood and Lifelong Friendships: Joining Phi Sigma Sigma provides the opportunity to form deep and lasting bonds with a diverse group of individuals who share common values, creating a supportive sisterhood that extends beyond college years.
Leadership Development: The sorority places a strong emphasis on leadership development. Members often have the chance to hold leadership positions within their chapters, fostering skills that are applicable both in college and future careers.
Academic Support: Phi Sigma Sigma encourages academic excellence and provides resources and support to help members achieve their educational goals. Many chapters offer study groups, mentorship programs, and recognition for academic achievements.
Community Service and Philanthropy: Members actively engage in philanthropic activities, supporting various charitable causes. Participating in community service events allows members to make a positive impact while fostering a sense of responsibility and giving back.
Personal Development: Through workshops, seminars, and programming, Phi Sigma Sigma offers opportunities for personal development. Topics may include time management, communication skills, and other life skills that contribute to members' overall well-being.
Networking Opportunities: Being a part of a national sorority provides access to a vast network of alumnae, offering valuable connections for career development and personal growth. Many chapters organize networking events and maintain active alumnae networks.
Social and Cultural Events: Membership in Phi Sigma Sigma includes participation in a variety of social events, fostering a sense of belonging and camaraderie. These events contribute to a well-rounded college experience.
Professional Development: Some chapters offer programs and resources aimed at preparing members for the professional world. This may include resume workshops, interview preparation, and networking events with alumnae who have successful careers.
Diversity and Inclusion: Phi Sigma Sigma promotes diversity and inclusion, creating an environment where members from various backgrounds feel welcomed and valued.
Personal Support System: Whether facing challenges or celebrating successes, Phi Sigma Sigma provides a built-in support system. Sisters often become a source of encouragement, guidance, and friendship during both the highs and lows of college life.

title: Pi Lambda Sigma
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Ideology & Politics, Law
mission:
The purpose of Pi Lambda Sigma is to provide undergraduate students interested in public policy, law, and government with opportunities for professional development, networking, community service, leadership training, and personal education about careers in relation to the government and the legal field in regards to the government. Our goals include the following. Career preparation: Workshops, resume help, speaker events with government officials, policy professionals, or alumni. Networking: Connections with faculty, alumni in law/government, and other students with similar career interests.
Leadership: Members can run for officer positions, draft constitutions/bylaws, plan programming (e.g., civic engagement events, policy debates). Service: Often emphasizes civic service and community outreach—things like voter registration drives, volunteering, and public policy advocacy. Social: Builds a cohort of peers who want to pursue government-related careers, with mixers or informal gatherings.

title: Pi Tau Sigma
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
The first (Alpha) chapter of Pi Tau Sigma, came into being at the University of Illinois on March 16, 1915 when a group of upperclassmen in mechanical engineering formed an honorary fraternity for exceptional mechanical engineering students. They believed that such an organization could foster cooperation between the students and faculty to promote worthwhile student activities such as:
Fostering the high ideals of the engineering profession
Stimulating interest in coordinating departmental activities
Promoting the professional welfare of its members
Developing mechanical engineering students with the attributes necessary for effective leadership
Cultivating a strong notion of the responsibilities of a citizen in society

title: Planned Parenthood Generation Action
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism
mission:
Planned Parenthood Generation Action at the University of Illinois
Urbana-Champaign exists to educate the university community about
reproductive health and rights, to translate increased awareness into pro-choice
activism on campus, and to serve as a coalition partner to state, national, and
international reproductive rights efforts. Students for PPGA believe in the
fundamental rights of every individual to manage their fertility. We support full
access to comprehensive reproductive and complementary health care services in
settings that preserve and protect the essential privacy and rights of each
individual; advocate for public policies that guarantee these rights and ensure
access to such services; and support access to medically accurate educational
programs that enhance understanding of human sexuality.
b. As outlined in the University of Illinois Student Code, PPGA will follow Title
IX and the Clergy Act.

membership_benefits:
