Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The objects of this Fraternity for which we stand united are: (1) To make a significant contribution to the colleges and universities with which its undergraduate and alumni members are associated, to the communities in which its members reside, and to the great countries of the United States of America and Canada; (2) To promote the adoption of significant life goals by its members, together with plans for their fulfillment; (3) The promotion of the highest moral, intellectual, and social excellence and educational standards in all its members; and (4) The union of all its members in a firm and enduring friendship and true brotherhood for life.

title: Psicología, Avance, Sociedad, Oportunidades, y Servicio
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: PASOS, meaning “steps” in Spanish, represents the journey of growth, progress, and support we take together as students. Our organization is open to all UIUC students, especially those in the College of Liberal Arts & Sciences—who are interested in psychology, mental health, and serving the Latine community. Each letter of PASOS stands for a step: advancing knowledge in Psicología, building Avance through education, strengthening Sociedad (community), creating Oportunidades, and centering Servicio (service). Through these steps, we aim to empower underrepresented voices, promote cultural awareness, and create an inclusive space where students can learn, connect, and thrive academically, personally, and professionally.

title: Psych Bites Undergraduate Psychology Journal
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission:
Psych Bites serves to:
i. Publish at minimum one high-quality, peer-reviewed issue per academic year to educate on research developments in the University of Illinois psychology community and/or the broader psychology community.
ii. Provide opportunities for professional growth of its members through the inclusion of featured guest speakers, writer’s workshops, leadership experiences, and scholarly publication.
iii. Foster connections with the broader University of Illinois student body through events welcoming of members and non-members and events in collaboration with established RSOs.
iv. Promote equity in mental health through philanthropy and/or volunteering events.

title: Psychology Research and Community Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: Our mission is to provide club members with research experience. Through research conducted in the club, members will familiarize themselves with the process of posing a research question, collecting data, analyzing data, and advocating for mental health using the data. In addition, PRACC will teach members how to hold conversations with empathy using different frameworks of psychotherapy.

title: Psychology Survey Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Information & Data Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: To create a positive, welcoming, and low-stakes social environment to explore one's psychology oriented interests in a project-based format.

title: Public Interest Law Foundation
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The Public Interest Law Foundation is an organization of alumni, students and faculty of the University of Illinois, College of Law. It was created fie two purposes: to encourage law students and alumni to pursue public interest law work and help make it financially feasible for them to do so.

title: Public Policy Leaders
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Ideology & Politics, Law
mission:
Public Policy Leaders is an organization at UIUC dedicated to helping students
navigate careers in public policy, especially for those not following the traditional law school
pathway. Our mission is to provide valuable insights into various policy careers through events
with faculty, government officials, and industry professionals. We also offer professional
development workshops, including resume writing and LinkedIn sessions, in collaboration with
the Career Center. Through hands-on experiences such as case studies, we encourage students to
explore critical policy issues, develop leadership skills, and contribute to bipartisan solutions.
Open to all majors, our club fosters an inclusive environment that values diverse perspectives,
welcoming all students passionate about shaping the future of public policy to join us.

title: Puerto Rican Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture
mission: Our mission as the Puerto Rican Student Association is to provide a sense of community and uplift Puerto Ricans here on campus. We want to educate, promote, and celebrate Puerto Rican Culture. We hope to bridge the Puerto Ricans across the diaspora to reconnect to our histories, culture, and each other.
membership_benefits: Customized accessories and clothing for members and connections to cultural programs. A voice for all members to speak out on any issues or topics about Puerto Rico.

title: Pulse
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Shall be to create a conference focused on Electrical and Computer Engineering.

title: Quant
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
Website: https://www.quantillinois.com
Discord: https://discord.com/invite/xnjdcgteKR

title: Queer Book Club
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: The Queer Book Club serves as a place to explore and discuss LGBTQ+ representation in media, with a specific focus on meaningful queer representation in literature. The Queer Book Club strives to provide opportunities for student connection and an accepting and supportive environment to discuss the diversity of queer experiences.

title: Queer Wellness at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: To help queer people at the University of Illinois to have a place to improve their mental, emotional, and physical wellbeing.

title: Raas Mania
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission:
To organize a cultural show that preserves and spreads the India cultural
dance of Garba Raas while spreading awareness to the beauty of the
artform.
To invite students from across the country to participate in an
intercollegiate interactive competition.
To facilitate conversation, in regards to Indian culture, that broadens the
perspective of our fellow students, faculty, Champaign-Urbana community
and students from across the country.

title: Re: verie
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: Re: verie serves as the only non-audition K-pop dance club on campus. Re: verie aims to make dance fun and available to students who may not have the time or years of experience for a competitive team. Additionally, Re: verie provides a space to meet people with similar interests.
membership_benefits: Members of Re: verie will have free admission to all Re: verie events.

title: REACH
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business, Media Arts, Social & Leisure
mission:
Illini influencers work to empower all types of students to connect with fashion and
beauty companies to tailor their personal brand using social media platforms. Regardless of the
student’s current social media footprint, the organization commoves students to use different
social media platforms to amplify their following.

title: Reaching Across Classes
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: To help freshmen students of color transition into college smoothly also while working closely with them to make sure they will be ready for the academic and social demands they encounter. Within this program, each student will be assigned a mentor, given resources and opportunities, and be able to go to programs/events/volunteering engagements that will give them important information and experience that can help them in the future.
membership_benefits:
- Become a leader on campus through mentorship and involvement.
- Fellowship with other members of your community through enjoyable social and informative events.
- Get the opportunity to be creative in bringing new events for students to enjoy.

title: Real Estate Law Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission:
The purpose of RELS is to build connections, foster discussion and enhance learning about the various ways the law intersects with real estate. It seeks to connect like-minded individuals to explore their interests on the many matters and stakeholders in the real estate field.
The club aims to accomplish this goal by way of regular meetings, guest speakers, social events, and email newsletter.

title: Recreational Volleyball
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission: The Club serves to provide an opportunity for its members to play casual yet competitive volleyball on a consistent basis.

title: RecruitME
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
RecruitME is a 6-week bootcamp designed for second-semester mechanical
engineering sophomores to gain the skills, experience, and confidence needed to secure competitive internships. Our mission is to bridge the gap between academic learning and industry expectations through hands-on technical workshops, resume and interview prep, peer mentorship, and guest speaker events featuring engineers and recruiters from top companies. We aim to build a supportive, career-focused community that empowers students to take ownership of their professional development early on.

title: Red Bison Ecological Restoration
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Environmental & Sustainability, Health & Wellness, Social & Leisure
mission: Red Bison is dedicated to championing environmental justice and stewarding healthy ecosystems within and beyond the University of Illinois campus. We strive not only to restore and maintain the natural environment but also to confront systemic issues. Together, we work towards a harmonious coexistence between nature and society, grounded in principles of solidarity and collective action.

title: Reformed University Fellowship
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: Our mission is to grow with students in faith, community, and friendship.

title: Remote Area Medical Chapter at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture
mission: The RAM Chapter at UIUC serves to reduce pain and ease suffering by offering free, high-quality healthcare to those in need. At the University of Illinois, we strive to be leaders in operating clinics that improve the quality of life by delivering care to impoverished, isolated, and underserved communities.

title: Retrieval Augmented Generation @ UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
RAG@UIUC serves to Focus on educating the students about AI,Databases and how information retrieval takes place for AI models. Through
education lectures and projects we will encourage students to build out AI projects for different use cases.
membership_benefits:
1)Allowed to attend weekly lectures
2)Take part in semester long projects
3)Network with professionals

title: Retrocomputing and Hardware at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Retrocomputing and Hardware at Illinois serves as the place for enthusiasts of retrocomputing and other old technology at University of Illinois to share, learn, and have fun enjoying the hobby. Our primary topic of focus is computing hardware, but anyone interested in retro audio, video, gaming, and photography will feel right at home in our weekly meetings. For more ambitious members, we undertake projects aimed at repairing and maintaining old hardware for preservation, and we have FPGA projects targeting emulation as a form of enrichment and coursework preparation.
membership_benefits:
Access to RSO resources: computer hardware, repair, emulation, and development equipment (such as FPGAs)
Hang out with an easygoing community of retro-tech enthusiasts

title: Revamp
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Information & Data Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Revamp is a student-run technology consulting club centered around Agentic AI and Data Analytics. The organization exists for two main purposes: to provide consulting services for client projects, and to create educational opportunities for companies and students through application-based pedagogy. Revamp’s mission is to not only leverage the ever-evolving industry by observing and adapting to fast-paced traction of the technological frontiers, but also to give students a nurturing platform to learn industry-grade AI and Data solutions beyond classrooms.

title: Rho Epsilon, Student Real Estate Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The University of Illinois Rho Epsilon Student Real Estate Association offers students a practical, hands-on, experience in commercial real estate. We expose members to diverse career paths within the industry, introduce students to industry specific knowledge, and grow connections with professionals, providing invaluable networking opportunities that enhance their education and future career prospects in Real Estate.

title: Robobrawl
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
The Robobrawl Committee organization aims to foster and serve the robotics community
by providing opportunities for students and community members to learn about and participate in
combat robotics. Over the course of the year, we host weekly workshops in order to discuss the
basics and introduce newcomers to the art of combat robotics. Furthermore we host build
sessions exclusively for our members to aid in the construction of their robots with technical
support, guidance and materials, as well as free viewing of the 30lb Robobrawl competition.
Additionally we provide professional experiences within our organization, through
various technical projects to improve upon the competition. These are worked on throughout the
year and improve the quality of the competition.
We give back to our community by allowing free participation and attendance to our 1lb
competitions to local hobbyists and students, further fostering a combat robotics community
within UIUC. These are hosted multiple times throughout the year.
membership_benefits:
Ability to participate in the Robobrawl 30lb competition without payment
Exclusive build and help sessions by experienced members for 1lb combat robots
Priority registration for all Robobrawl Combat Robotics events

title: Rocky Horror UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: Rocky Horror UIUC serves to host semesterly screenings of The Rocky Horror Picture Show (RHPS) on campus. Since the 1970s, theaters have screened RHPS with shadow casts reenacting the film in real time before a lively audience. Rocky Horror UIUC screenings feature a shadow cast performed and put on by students. Students will have the opportunity to be in either/both the cast or/and production team and engage in a collaborative process to host The Rocky Horror Picture Show for our campus community. Rocky Horror UIUC offers students a space to be creative and contribute regardless of prior theater experience. We are here to spread our love of The Rocky Horror Picture Show and have fun doing it.

title: Root to Roof
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Environmental & Sustainability
mission:
Root to Roof is a student-led design-build organization serving the Central Illinois
community. Our mission is to engage future architects to think critically about locally harvested
lumber, hand-crafting, and the principles of sustainability through active project planning and
participation.
The organization will start with small-scale intervention projects. Root to Roof eventually aims
to create quality, energy efficient large-scale solutions to solve for issues of homelessness and
poverty in the local area.

title: Roselle
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International, Performance Arts
mission:
[Roselle] serves as the/to create a close and positive bonding in the university
community through dancing and spread Chinese culture via performances.

title: Rube Goldberg Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: We are a group of 20 undergrad and graduate students building a Rube Goldberg Machine to compete in the National Rube Goldberg Machine Competition hosted at Purdue University. Through creating the machine, members experience iterative design techniques in a creative environment. Members also have the opportunity to engage in community education in teaching simple machines and basic chain reactions to local elementary schoolers.

title: Rural Area Student Initiative
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture
mission:
RASI exists to extend resources to rural high school students that are interested in pursuing
higher education. In addition, RASI will serve as a space for rural college students to support one
another as they adjust to the university environment.

title: Russian Speaking Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International, Social & Leisure
mission:
Russian Speaking Organization serves as the union for Russian speakers on
campus. Our goal is to bring awareness to Russian-speaking countries’ culture, history and
traditions, and to form a community for Russian native speakers and those who are learning or
interested in learning Russian.

title: Salaam Middle East & North Africa (MENA) Cultural Center
tags:
Student Affairs Departments & Programs
 
 - Identity & Culture, International
mission: The mission and vision of the Salaam Middle East & North Africa (MENA) Cultural Center are to provide a home for a border-fluid MENA community and to inspire holistic student success, inclusion, and belonging. By fostering the development of critical, intercultural citizens and global leaders who are better equipped to read and engage our complex and nuanced world, we hope to leave our communities better places than we found them.

title: Saudi Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission:
The Saudi Students Association (SSA) at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign is dedicated to
creating a welcoming community that celebrates Saudi culture, supports Saudi students, and fosters crosscultural understanding. We aim to represent and advocate for Saudi students on campus, provide social,
cultural, and academic support, and organize events that promote Saudi heritage and traditions. Our goal
is to build bridges between Saudi students and the wider university community, while inspiring
leadership, service, and unity among our members. Through our activities, we strive to create a vibrant
and inclusive environment where all students feel connected, supported, and proud to share their culture.

title: Save the Children Action Network at University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism
mission: SCAN UIUC’s purpose is spreading awareness and advocating in support of issues affecting children worldwide. We’re building bipartisan will and voter support to make sure every child in the U.S. has access to high-quality early learning and that children in conflict-affected areas are protected.

title: Scandinavian Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, International
mission:
Scan club serves as a way for University of Illinois students to engage with Scandinavian
culture and identity through interacting with various traditions, foods, film, as well as
language. The club is open to those with family ties to Scandinavia, native speakers, or
those who are hoping to learn more about the culture. All are welcome!

title: Secular Student Alliance
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Ideology & Politics, Social & Leisure
mission: The UIUC SSA serves to bring about a society in which the ideals of scientific rationality, secularism, and human based ethics flourish. Whereas many other organizations already exist to spread these values to off-campus populations, the UIUC Secular Student Alliance focuses on fostering these values among college students. The UIUC Secular Student Alliance specifically seeks to organize, unite, educate and serve students and student communities that promote the ideals of scientific rationality, secularism, and human based ethics.

title: Security Studies Group
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission:
ACDIS SSG aims to establish a pre-professional network assisting members with
making connections, finding internships and research opportunities, making
available visits from recruiters, utilizing campus resources, etc
ACDIS SSG aims to develop members’ skills by offering training, intelligence and
defense-related simulation practice, leadership opportunities and more
ACDIS SSG aims to facilitate a collaborative environment by planning group
socials, outings, and other such activities that contribute to the development of
“espirit de corps”

title: Serbian Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Serbian Student Association is a cultural organization that serves as an inclusive community for native Serbian speakers, students with Serbian heritage, and individuals interested in Serbian culture and language. The SSA’s mission also stands to bring awareness of Serbian culture, traditions, and history in the United States to the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

title: SGI Buddhists for World Peace
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission:
SGI Buddhists for World Peace (SGI-BWP) serves as the place for the
students who want to study Nichiren Buddhism and learn the philosophy of Buddhist
philosopher, peace-builder, educator, and writer, Daisaku Ikeda, who has received 401 academic
honors as of 2023. The fundamental purpose of the SGI-BWP is to help students unlock their
hidden potential and achieve creative harmony with their environment through the philosophy
and practice of Nichiren Buddhism in the SGI-USA. This is the ultimate expression of individual
empowerment – that each student can transform the inevitable challenges of daily life into
sources of growth and fulfillment and become a positive influence in his or her school,
workplace, family and community. By promoting and understanding of how Nichiren Buddhism
can be applied to the challenges of modern living, our activities contribute to the development of
peace, culture, and education within society, inspire respect for cultural diversity and human
rights, and encourage the protection of nature and the environment.

title: Sharing Smiles with Hospice Patients
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness
mission:
Sharing Smiles with Hospice Patients UIUC has three main goals:
1) To function as a support system for students currently involved with hospice volunteering by building community on our campus.
2) To educate our student body by fostering a safe and welcoming environment for students of all majors to learn about hospice and palliative care.
3) To help support volunteers and their hospice patients by making cards/crafts for patients, and by filming legacy videos for them to preserve their stories.
membership_benefits:
Members of Sharing Smiles with Hospice Patients UIUC will have the following benefits within the organization:
1) Ability to apply for leadership positions within the organization.
2) Volunteering opportunities on and off campus.

title: She's the First UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: This student organization raises funds and awareness for girls' education in low-income countries across the globe. Proceeds are sent directly to the national She’s the First organization at the end of each school year.

title: Sibshops UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: The Sibshops UIUC serves as a program and movement designed to support the siblings of individuals with special needs or disabilities. The mission of Sibshops is to create a safe and supportive space where these siblings, often referred to as "sibs," can come together to connect with others who share similar experiences, gain information and insights, and build essential life skills. The goals of a Sibshops UIUC is to provide support, education, connection, skill-building, fun and advocacy to the Champaign-Urbana community.
membership_benefits:
1) Ability to hold a chair/executive board position
2) Ability to create connections with Champaign-Urbana community
3) Free admission to Sibshops facilitator training

title: Sigma Alpha Epsilon Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The mission of Sigma Alpha Epsilon is to promote the highest standards of friendship, scholarship, and service by our members based upon the ideals set forth by our Founders and as specifically enunciated in "The True Gentleman."

title: Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity for Women
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
THE MISSION OF Sigma Alpha Iota International Music Fraternity IS TO
ENCOURAGE, NURTURE, AND SUPPORT THE ART OF MUSIC.

title: Sigma Alpha Mu Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: To foster and maintain among its sons a spirit of fraternity, a spirit of mutual moral aid and support; to instill and maintain in the hearts of its sons love for and loyalty to Alma Mater and its ideals; to inculcate among its sons such ideals as will result in actions worthy of the highest precepts of true manhood, democracy, and humanity.

title: Sigma Alpha Professional Agricultural Sorority
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The objective of this sorority shall be to promote its members in all facets of agriculture and to strengthen the bonds of friendship among them. It is the purpose of its members to strive for achievement in scholarship, leadership, and service, and to further the development of excellence in women pursuing careers in agriculture.

title: Sigma Beta Rho Fraternity, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission:
To share the three pillars of Society, Brotherhood, and Remembrance to its
members and the general community.
Together we also strive to establish a nationwide network that was
envisioned by our founding fathers. Through the years, we have carried
our ideals of Society, Brotherhood, and Remembrance beyond our original
objectives.
We accept individuals of all cultures, backgrounds, and beliefs and
promote diversity within our organization. It is our belief that these three
pillars help to create strong leaders for the community.

title: Sigma Chi Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: To foster a brotherhood of transformational leaders through friendship, justice, and learning.

title: Sigma Delta Tau
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Sigma Delta Tau’s mission is to empower each member to reach her fullest potential by enriching the experience of women with similar ideals, building lasting relationships, promoting civic responsibility, and fostering personal growth.

title: Sigma Gamma Rho Sorority, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The purpose of the Delta Rho Chapter is to enhance the quality of life for women and their families in the U.S. and globally through community service, civil, and social action. Our goal is to achieve greater progress in the areas of education, health awareness, and leadership development. Our members, affiliates, staff, and community partners work to create and support initiatives that align with our vision.

title: Sigma Lambda Beta International Fraternity Inc.-Kappa Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, International, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The purpose of this Chapter shall be primarily one of promoting Latino/Hispanic culture and standards of excellence in morality, ethics, and education. Further, the Chapter shall work to better serve the needs and wants of all people by disseminating the rich culture which we all share. Finally, the Chapter shall maintain respect for the views of others, so that through this tolerance we shall enhance our understanding of one another and better our community, our country, and the world

title: Sigma Lambda Gamma National Sorority Inc. Delta Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Ideology & Politics, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Through excellence in the organization’s five founding principles, Sigma Lambda Gamma provides opportunities for lifelong empowerment to its members, thereby positively influencing the global community.
membership_benefits: Being a sister of Sigma Lambda Gamma opens doors to a lifetime of sisterhood, professional advancement, and moral excellence.

title: Sigma Nu Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: To create an engaging social environment for young men of similar values.

title: Sigma Phi Delta Fraternity
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
We are Professional in that, unlike the General Fraternity, we admit to membership only students enrolled or working in a curriculum, or program, leading toward a degree in engineering; we participate in a continuing professional program through symposia, seminars, field trips, and similar programs.
We are Social in that, similar to the General Fraternity, our members maintain and live in Chapter houses; have a social program; participate in athletic programs; and foster a close relationship with our graduated, or alumni, members.

title: Sigma Phi Epsilon
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: We envision a new generation of men who lead with purpose and strong personal values, develop a sound mind and sound body through healthy, disciplined habits, and fulfill their potential through lifelong relationships.

title: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Sigma Psi Zeta Sorority, Inc. is a progressive, multicultural Greek Organization that provides a means to success and support for women, particularly women of color. We build on the unity of strong and independent leaders to affect change in our organization, our campuses, and our local communities.

title: Sikh Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture
mission:
Sikh Student Association serves as the student organization whose purpose is to
make known on campus aspects of Sikh and Punjabi culture, and to provide a safe place for
support and socialization to currently attending and alumni students of UIUC.

title: Singapore Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission:
UIUCSSA, a Registered Student Organization (RSO) of the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
(UIUC), is committed to fostering and maintaining a familiar community on campus for all Singaporeans
and partners at UIUC. The RSO is also committed to reaching out to the broader community at UIUC,
promoting awareness of Singaporean culture and opportunities.

title: SKATE for Girls
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
SKATE for Girls Illinois serves as a platform to empower young women through the
integration of figure skating and STEM education, with a focus on mathematics. Our mission is
to provide students with the opportunity to develop both athletic and academic skills in a
supportive and inclusive environment. We run weekly programs that include skating lessons,
tutoring sessions, and mentoring opportunities for middle school students. We aim to inspire
confidence, foster leadership, and promote the pursuit of STEM fields among girls on campus
and in the community. By offering mentorship, tutoring, and skating workshops, SKATE for
Girls Illinois seeks to build a community where students can excel both on the ice and in the
classroom.

title: Skateboarding Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Health & Wellness, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Skateboarding Illini RSO aims to promote a sense of community and acceptance among university students who seek to explore the sport and culture of skateboarding through self-expression, self-improvement, and community involvement.

title: Skeumorphics
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: The Skeuomorphics aims to foster learning opportunities and hands-on experiences in bookmaking and letterpress, encouraging creativity and skill development in book art and printmaking among the University of Illinois Urbana Champaign student community.
membership_benefits: Members of The Skeuomorphics gain access to unique resources and workshops in bookmaking and printmaking, enjoy discounted admission to paid events, and have the opportunity to participate in decision-making processes within the club. Additionally, active members can develop their skills in a collaborative and respectful environment while contributing to the growth and success of the organization.

title: SKY Meditation at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Social & Leisure
mission: Bringing meditation, breathwork, emotional intelligence, social connection, and service leadership to UIUC students, faculty and staff.

title: Snacks of the World
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: Snacks of the World will offer students at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign the opportunity to taste and learn more about different snack foods from various parts of the world.
membership_benefits:
Members of Snacks of the World will have the following benefits
within the organization:
1) Voting Rights; to be eligible to vote in electing club leaders, members must have been in
attendance for at least half the year’s meetings plus one (i.e. if the club met 12 times,
you’d have to have attended at least 6+1 meetings to vote)
2) Ability to travel with RSO
3) Free admission to RSO events
4) Access to food and beverages provided by RSO

title: Social Gaming Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Health & Wellness, Social & Leisure
mission: To maintain a friendly, welcoming environment for casual and competitive gamers in order to create and improve interpersonal connections. To enjoy all kinds of games, events, and activities together emphasizing good sportsmanship and mutual respect.
membership_benefits:
You get to come to the meetings and play games (membership not required to come play games).
https://discord.gg/C2V2Xe88wR <-- press to become member

title: Social Justice Initiative
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Environmental & Sustainability, Identity & Culture
mission:
The Social Justice Initiative serves to expand our collective knowledge and
understanding of the importance of social justice while sharing this need with our community
and school with the overall intent to increase social justice education. We aspire to increase
students’ critical awareness around structural systems of oppression, and actively promote
equality and equity for everyone in society using Human-Centered Design (HCD) through
workshops, collaborative community projects, and guest speakers.

title: Society for Business Management in Architecture
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Social & Leisure
mission:
The primary goal of the Society of Business Management in Architecture (SBMA) is to
inform and educate architecture students about the large array of opportunities available to them
in the fields of construction management, development, entrepreneurial thought, firm
management, law, and real estate.
It will then be the goal of the organization to help develop students into future business
leaders.
SBMA accomplishes these goals through the continual provision of forums for
collaboration and various events.
Many students will be interfacing with the business world; therefore, it is key we have a
resource that can provide these necessary skills. One of our main focuses is on the intersection of
architecture and other disciplines. We hope to allow students the opportunity to learn more about
the financing and logistics behind architecture in the marketplace.
The Illinois School of Architecture is a great support base and resource for our members.
Through our guest lectures, we hope to connect current professionals and the future generation of
world designers.
The Society of Business Management in Architecture is at the forefront of a new form of
holistic thought in architectural practice, bridging expertise and business proficiency.

title: Society for Ecological Restoration at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Environmental & Sustainability, Life & Physical Sciences
mission: The Society for Ecological Restoration at UIUC will be a club formed with the goal of educating about and promoting native landscape restoration. We would have a focus on connecting the many industries and people invested in conservation. We want to remind students that they are not alone in their intentions. The Society for Ecological Restoration is an international organization, with a midwest chapter devoted to promoting the science and practice of ecological restoration to assist with the recovery and management of degraded ecosystems throughout the Midwestern and Great Lakes region of the USA.

title: Society for Engineering Mechanics
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The Society for Engineering Mechanics (SEM) provides a community for UIUC students majoring in Engineering Mechanics (EM). Members collaborate and build projects to gain design experience and attend events to form and develop social, departmental, and professional ties. SEM collaborates with faculty to improve TAM courses and hosts social events for students and faculty to get to know each other.

title: Society for Equity in Astronomy
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Life & Physical Sciences
mission:
The Society for Equity in Astronomy (SEA) strives to promote equity and inclusion locally in
Astronomy and related fields. We work to maintain a safe space environment, where members
can feel free to talk about any problems they are having and explore the progression toward a
more diverse and welcoming astronomy community.

title: Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Information & Data Sciences, Life & Physical Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
To advance the application of mathematics and computational science to engineering, industry, science, and society.
To promote research that will lead to effective new mathematical and computational methods and techniques for science, engineering, industry, and society.
To provide media for the exchange of information and ideas among mathematicians, engineers, and scientists.
membership_benefits:
Free individual student membership to SIAM (https://www.siam.org/membership/individual-membership/), which provides access to:
- SIAM Review (Print & Electronic)
- SIAM News (Print)
- 30% Off SIAM Books
- Up to 85% Off Conference Registrations
- 80% Off Journals (up to 4)
- 95% Off e-Access to Journals
- SIAM Unwrapped

title: Society for the Advancement of Chicanos and Native Americans in Science - UIUC Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Life & Physical Sciences
mission: There is a future where STEM reflects the demographics of our country, so the field is better equipped to solve our world's most pressing problems. Through our people, programs, and partnerships, SACNAS has taken a radical approach to lead with culture and identity as the means to achieve true diversity in STEM.

title: Society for the Promotion of Indian Classical Music and Culture Amongst Youth
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission: SPICMACAY Illinois is a chapter of the international SPICMACAY movement, with the goal of promoting Indian cultural heritage, including music, dance, and other arts. SPICMACAY Illinois's mission is to organize jam sessions, performances, and other events to connect, promote, and practice Indian classical music and dance among the UIUC community.

title: Society for Women in Physics
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Society for Women in Physics serves as the social and professional network among female and other gender minority students, and their allies in the physics department in order to empower them throughout their career. SWIP also provides opportunities for its members to interact with other physics students, faculty, and the community in social, academic and philanthropic events.

title: Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Information & Data Sciences, International, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, Health & Human Sciences, ~ Affiliation: Asian American Cultural Center (AACC)
mission: The Society of Asian Scientists and Engineers (SASE) is dedicated to helping Asian and Asian-American Students unlock their full potential through career, professional, and social development while celebrating APIDA culture.

title: Society of Hispanic Professional Engineers
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
A) Maintain and increase the enrollment of Hispanics and other minorities in
engineering and science programs at UIUC.
B) Provide information to Hispanic and other minorities at all grade levels concerning
programs available in engineering and science.
C) Provide academic guidance, access to academic resources, leadership opportunities,
career development, and career orientation for our members.
D) Provide a meeting place for students with similar interests, goals, and backgrounds.

title: Society of Professional Journalists
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission:
It is the role of journalists to provide this information in an accurate, comprehensive, timely and understandable manner.
It is the mission of the Society of Professional Journalists:
— To promote this flow of information.
— To maintain constant vigilance in protection of the First Amendment guarantees of freedom of speech and of the press.
— To stimulate high standards and ethical behavior in the practice of journalism.
— To foster excellence among journalists.
— To inspire successive generations of talented individuals to become dedicated journalists.
— To encourage diversity in journalism.
— To be the pre-eminent, broad-based membership organization for journalists.
— To encourage a climate in which journalism can be practiced freely.
membership_benefits: Networking with alumni and professionals in journalism and adjacent fields, professional development and skill building, workforce preparedness, introduction to campus media and career resources.

title: Society of Women Engineers
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Empower women to achieve their full potential in careers as engineers and leaders; expand the image of the engineering and technology professions as a positive force in improving the quality of life, and demonstrate the value of diversity and inclusion.
membership_benefits:
The Society of Women Engineers is a technical, professional, social, and outreach organization here at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign and is part of a larger organization with over 14,000 members nationally. With an officer board of 17 and over 80 chair positions, there are many ways for you to get involved and build your resume!
Some of our most popular events include Girl Scout Workshops, a Night of Networking providing corporate workshops and career opportunities, a barn dance, semi-formal, and a yearly technical project competition.
In addition to all of our events here on campus, becoming a national member of SWE allows you to attend national and regional conferences and pursue many scholarship opportunities. We are the largest engineering organization on campus and provide a great support system for women in engineering.

title: Society of Women in Business
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The Society of Women in Business at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign is committed to uniting women and giving them essential skills and experiences to succeed in business.

title: Society of Women in Neuroscience
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Health & Human Sciences
mission: The Society of Women in Neuroscience empowers women to thrive in science through community, mentorship, and purpose. We are committed to supporting one another, giving back, and creating spaces where women in neuroscience feel seen, supported, and inspired to lead.

title: Society of Women In Public Affairs
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Honorary, Ideology & Politics, Law, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission: Our mission is to prepare undergraduate women for their future careers in Public Affairs by providing them with a platform to grow as individuals and professionals. Our three core pillars; professionalism, service, and sisterhood provide our diverse cohort of members with various experiences needed to foster their growth. Public Affairs is a large diverse field, so by exposing our members to a range of opportunities and experiences they are better equipped to succeed in the professional world.

title: Sociology Student Organization (SSO)
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: SSO is a place for sociology majors, minors, and sociologically curious people to come together academically, socially, and professionally. Our mission is to empower members by providing opportunities for professional development and creating a social support system within our organization. We are driven by the belief that by nurturing students' academic, professional, and personal growth, we can create a powerful future for the world of sociology. We hope to foster an inclusive community with diverse perspectives to work towards a more just and equitable society.
membership_benefits: We empower members through a multifaceted approach, offering professional development opportunities and fostering a robust social support system. Through engagement with theoretical concepts and practical application, we cultivate a community that encourages critical thinking, inclusivity, and social awareness. We facilitate connections between students and their broader communities, both on and off-campus, providing resources for meaningful involvement and networking opportunities. Our mentorship programs, educational initiatives, and events serve to equip students with the tools they need to navigate their academic journey and beyond, instilling in them the confidence to advocate for justice and equity.

title: South Asian Law Students Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Mission of SALSA is to promote academic and professional excellence in the legal field, advocate for the interests of its members and South Asian students at the College of Law, raise awareness of legal issues affecting South Asian students, maintain a network of SALSA alumni, provide its members with a valuable support network of friends and resources to help enrich their law school experience, build coalitions with other student organizations and contribute to the University of Illinois community at large, and foster solidarity.

title: Space Law Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The SLS serves as the University of Illinois College of Law student organization dedicated to educating students within the College of Law on the developing field of Space Law. SLS serves to connect students with other Space Law organizations, and further the careers of students in Space Law.

title: Spanish and Portuguese Graduate Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Social & Leisure
mission:
The purpose(s) of this organization shall be to represent, unify and to meet the needs of the graduate students in the Spanish and Portuguese Department.
Organization website: https://publish.illinois.edu/spanportgradorg/

title: Speak Your Migraine
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Health & Wellness
mission: The RSO Speak Your Migraine UIUC serves to build a community for students on the UIUC campus who are impacted by migraine. This is accomplished through a focus on providing a supportive social network for members, bringing awareness to migraine through education, and creating migraine-accessible spaces on the UIUC campus. Through advocating for a migraine-accessible UIUC campus, Speak Your Migraine UIUC aligns itself with UIUC’s decades-long commitment to student accessibility.
membership_benefits: Members will have voting rights (electing officers, making changes to the constitution) and the ability to travel with Speak Your Migraine UIUC.

title: Special Olympics Unified Sports UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Athletic & Recreation, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture
mission:
Special Olympics Unified Sports UIUC is an organization that serves to join students and people with intellectual and developmental disabilities (IDD) on the same team. It was inspired by a simple principle: training together and playing together is a quick path to friendship and inclusion. Unified partners are college students without intellectual disabilities playing with Special Olympics athletes, individuals with IDD on an equal playing field.
Special Olympics Unified Sports also values inclusive leadership, inviting students and Special Olympics athletes to fulfill meaningful roles and lead together in their college program. Ultimately, Special Olympics Unified Sports UIUC aims to increase inclusion on our campus and in the surrounding Champaign-Urbana community for people with IDD through sports and competition.

title: Special Populations' Student Health Concerns Committee
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: SPSHCC is a registered student organization that works closely with the campus, along with community groups and social agencies. The mission of the SPSHCC is to increase general health awareness, improve health status, and promote a change of behavior that will lead to a healthier lifestyle among diverse University of Illinois student populations and the general public. This organization provides students with opportunities to improve their personal/professional skills in team building, public relations, leadership roles, fund raising, program planning, implementation, and evaluation.

title: Spicy Clamato Improv
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: Spicy Clamato Improv serves as the team for people looking to get involved in improv, specifically in short form improv games (a la “Who’s Line is it Anyway?”). We host comedy shows (regularly themed and costumed!) where we perform our improv. We work to create bonds with each other as a team while also enhancing our comedic abilities and powers. We also foster connections with other improv teams from Illinois through the performances, improv jams, and skill-building workshops of our annual improv comedy festival.

title: Sports & Entertainment Law Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The Sports and Entertainment Law Society (SELS) serves to educate students about the many legal issues that affect the world of sports and entertainment, as well as to provide networking and career opportunities within the sports and entertainment legal industries.

title: Sports Analytics Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Information & Data Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission: At SAS, we engage in a variety of activities aimed at enhancing our members’ understanding and application of sports analytics. This includes organizing insightful workshops, inviting industry experts for guest lectures, and creating opportunities for networking with professionals in the field.

title: Sprout UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction
mission: Sprout is an organization of students committed to empowering underprivileged students in the surrounding Urbana-Champaign community by providing student-led workshops and seminars regarding personal financial literacy and careers in finance and business. We strive to equip students with the skills and opportunities necessary to pursue higher education whilst also achieving financial success.

title: Squirrel and Bird Watching Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability
mission: The Squirrel and Bird Watching Club is dedicated to the observation and appreciation of squirrels and birds on the UIUC campus. These important creatures are a vital part of the local ecosystem, and we hope to share our admiration of both these animals within the Squirrel and Bird Watching Club as well as with the university and local community. We believe Squirrel and Bird Watching should be open to all UIUC students, regardless of personal identity or views, and to that end we seek to provide a space for any squirrel or bird enthusiast at UIUC. Included in our mission is the observation and understanding of related species that coinhabit and interact with squirrels and birds. This includes but is not limited to predators (coyotes, snakes, foxes), habitats (various trees including the noble oak), and relatives (chipmunks, lagomorphs, and other Rodentia or Mammalia).

title: Sri Lankan Cultural Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Sri Lankan Cultural Association serves to educate and spread awareness to the general public about Sri Lankan culture through informational and celebratory events.

mission:
The RSO serves to connect students interested in statistical consulting to local community
service projects that require statistical expertise. StatCom will support students to develop vital
communicative and analytical skills with real life applications in a collaborative setting.
membership_benefits:
Members of StatCom will have the following benefits within the
organization:
1) Connection to community consulting opportunities
2) Voting rights pertaining to StatCom events and affairs
3) Ability to travel with the RSO
4) Ability to represent the RSO

title: Steel Bridge
tags:
