mission: The Steel Bridge serves as the way for students to gain hands-on experience of steel design and fabrication.

title: Stiletto Queens
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Performance Arts
mission: Stiletto Queens is a dance team that specializes in dancing in stilettos. Our mission is to provide professional dance instruction and instill an appreciation for the art of stiletto dance in a safe, inclusive environment. We aim to build dance skills, self-confidence, and strength in individuals dancing with stilettos. Although primarily heel dancing, our team also incorporates various dance styles such as modern-day hip-hop, Latin, contemporary, and jazz.

title: Stitching Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The Stitching Illini serves as a way for students to be involved with crocheting, knitting, and other needle arts as a group.

title: Strengthening and Empowering Educators of Diverse Statuses
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: “They tried to bury us, but they didn’t know we were seeds,” an old Mexican proverb that inspired the start of SEEDS. SEEDS, Strengthening and Empowering Educators of Diverse Statuses, is a student-led organization that focuses on meeting the unique needs of undergraduate students from diverse statuses, including race, ethnicity, gender, age, socio-economic status, disabilities, etc. We strive to create a safe haven in which students are welcome to have an open dialogue about struggles,

title: Structural Engineers Association of Illinois Student Chapter (SEAOI)
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The Structural Engineers Association of Illinois (SEAOI) Chapter at the University of Illinois aims to connect students in Structural Engineering and Architecture with each other, Alumni, and corporate representatives currently in the industry. We have hosted some of the best engineers in the industry who shared with us their experiences and most challenging projects. The student chapter is in cooperation with the Illinois chapter, SEAOI, which provides students and young engineers many opportunities and resources to connect with other structural engineers at all levels of experience.

title: Student Academy of Audiology
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: The mission of the University of Illinois Chapter of the Student Academy of Audiology is to serve as a collective voice for students within the chapter area and to advance the rights, interests, and welfare of students pursuing careers in audiology. Chapters will engage students in lifelong professional activities that promote and advance the profession of audiology, and provide services, information, education, representation and advocacy for the profession and the public we serve.

title: Student Affairs Sustainability
tags:
Student Affairs Departments & Programs
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Agricultural, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Environmental & Sustainability, Identity & Culture, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: Student Affairs is committed to fostering a sustainable future through proactive engagement in sustainability education and sustainable actions. We advance this mission by implementing and rigorously evaluating our initiatives and nurturing leadership in sustainability. We believe that focusing on creating an inclusive, sustainable future empowers every individual to thrive.

title: Student Aircraft Builders
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: SAB will provide opportunities for member growth by maximizing the learning potential of engineering projects, encouraging personal development, and creating a productive club atmosphere.

title: Student Alumni Ambassadors
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission:
Student Alumni Ambassadors (SAA) is a student-run organization sponsored by the University of Illinois Alumni Association. SAA’s role on campus is to develop positive relations and interactions among students, alumni, faculty and staff. SAA provides an opportunity for students to realize their fullest potential for involvement and experience while at Illinois.
SAA brings together a diverse group of students from the University with a variety of interests, majors and backgrounds. These students work together to spread the enthusiasm, energy and resources of the University of Illinois to alumni and students alike while developing a lifelong connection and loyalty to the University of Illinois.
Today, SAA has an active membership of more than 90 students who work to further the quality of the University as an institution of higher education.
membership_benefits: Members are connected to alumni, plan large scale events, and are given a community of passionate students.

title: Student Ambassadors of UIPD
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: Our mission is to provide students the opportunity to achieve a better understanding of the University of Illinois Police Department (UIPD) and the resources that are available for the community. Through active engagement we aim to broaden students’ knowledge base by participating in committees facilitated by the department to support our local communities and law enforcement.

title: Student Art History Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: SAHA serves to promote interdisciplinary scholarship and new research that broadens our understanding of the arts.

title: Student Bar Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness, Law, Social & Leisure
mission:
The Student Bar Association (Association) serves as the representative organization of all students in the College of Law at the University of Illinois.
The Association shall serve as the coordinator, organizer, and facilitator of proposals and programs by the students of the College of Law. The Association shall also promote the role of students in the decision-making process relative to the College of Law and those other policy-making bodies whose actions affect the students at the College of Law. The Association shall determine which student organizations shall be recognized within the College of Law.

title: Student Chapter of The American College of Veterinary Pathologists at Illinois
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Veterinary
mission:
Section 1. To promote collegiality and professional development of its associates through
its programs and by its relations with other Student Chapters and with the parent body, the
American College of Veterinary Pathologists.
Section 2. To encourage veterinary student involvement in the field of veterinary pathology
and provide an additional opportunity for its associates to gain professional knowledge in
this field.
Section 3. To make available to the students the opportunities oEered by the American
College of Veterinary Pathologists to its Student Chapters.
Section 4. To contribute to the development of the field of veterinary pathology at University
of Illinois Urbana-Champaign through activities involving the faculty and student
associates.

title: Student Consortium for Conservation GIS and Remote Sensing
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Information & Data Sciences
mission:
The Student Consortium for Conservation GIS and Remote Sensing (SCCGRS) is a student-led network dedicated to fostering the next generation of scholars and practitioners in conservation science, GIS, and remote sensing. We connect students, researchers, and professionals who share a passion for leveraging geospatial technologies to tackle environmental and conservation challenges.
SCCGRS is open to anyone interested in conservation, GIS, remote sensing, or environmental science—whether you're an aspiring researcher, a data science enthusiast, or simply someone who is interested in preserving our natural and cultural heritage. Throughout the year, we plan to host guest speakers from academia, industry, and conservation organizations to discuss cutting-edge research and applications in conservation GIS and remote sensing. We also organize hands-on workshops, networking events, and field excursions to explore how geospatial technologies are used in conservation practice. Additionally, we aim to host career panel sessions featuring professionals from academia, industry, and government, offering insights into various career paths in conservation, GIS, and remote sensing.
SCCGRS is committed to building a strong and inclusive community. We collaborate with academic or professional groups focusing on conservation such as the Society for Conservation GIS, participate in mapping, and data-driven conservation projects, and support student-led initiatives aimed at applying GIS and remote sensing to real-world environmental challenges. Whether you're new to GIS or an experienced user, SCCGRS provides opportunities to learn, engage, and contribute to conservation efforts globally.

title: Student Dietetic Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness
mission:
The University of Illinois chapter of the Student Dietetic Association has been created as
a professional group of students that aim to be future Registered Dietitian Nutritionists—and the
best in the field, at that. To reach this goal, the members of the club will have the opportunity to
travel to professional events, volunteer in nutrition related philanthropy, and network with
renowned professionals in the field. Funds for the club will be raised through key sponsorships,
collection of dues, and various other fundraising activities, as well as through funding from the
University of Illinois. The club also will maintain its status as a Registered Student Organization
(RSO).

title: Student Engagement
tags: Student Affairs Departments & Programs
mission: Student Engagement supports student leaders through educational development and advisement to achieve their goals and create an involved and sustainable Illinois campus community.
membership_benefits: Our Teams: Spirit & Traditions, Student Governance, Student Org Development & Admin (SODA), Student Org Finance Center (SOFC) & Student Sustainability

title: Student Media Marketing Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Honorary, Media Arts
mission: Student Media Marketing association aims to provide the individuals within the organization an environment that fosters creativity and allows them to learn more about media and marketing.

title: Student Nurses' Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: Student Nursing Association is dedicated to supporting pre-nursing students in their academic journeys. We provide resources, mentorship, and peer support to help students succeed academically and prepare for nursing careers. Through educational workshops and community engagement, we strive to foster excellence, compassion, and resilience in future healthcare professionals.

title: Student Organ Donation Advocates
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism
mission: The purpose of this organization is to train students on how to become organ donation advocates, sign up students and faculty to become organ donors and educate on the importance of organ donation.

title: Student Organization Resource Fee (SORF) Board
tags: Student Affairs Departments & Programs
mission: The Student Organization Resource Fee or SORF is a student-initiated fee with the purpose to assist in funding programs and services of student organizations at Illinois.

title: Student Planning Organization
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Humanities
mission:
To promote interest in and understanding of the professional field of Urban and
Regional Planning.
To provide a forum for intellectual and social interchange among students studying
Urban Planning.
To act as the official spokesperson for students in the Department of Urban and
Regional Planning in all matters pertaining to interuniversity, intrauniversity, student
staff, and student-professional relationships; and
To promote fellowship between Urban Planning students and the staff of the
Department of Urban and Regional Planning.

title: Student Sustainability Leadership Council
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Environmental & Sustainability
mission:
SSLC is a hub to facilitate collaboration & communication between student groups,
administration, and community members; spearhead and assist educational programming; and
advocate for students’ campus sustainability goals. This role includes the following duties:
a. Provide educational programming
b. Act as a centralizing entity between sustainability-oriented groups on campus, campus
administration, and the community
c. Coordinate and promote campus sustainability efforts
d. Advocate for students’ campus sustainability concerns

title: Students Assisting Generational Empowerment
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Health & Wellness
mission: The mission of Students Assisting Generational Empowerment (SAGE) focuses on implementing a program to empower the elderly by encouraging social inclusion, recreational opportunities, and community-based engagement. By introducing hobby workshops and a way for the elderly to give back to other communities, SAGE’s student volunteer initiative creates a sustainable solution for the ongoing battle of social isolation, inactivity, and decreased quality of life that the elderly often face.

title: Students Consulting for Nonprofit Organizations
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Community Service & Philanthropy
mission:
Consulting with Purpose.
Students Consulting for Nonprofit Organizations (SCNO) is a registered student organization at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign that was founded by a group of students in 2010.
Since our establishment, we've served over 60 nonprofit organizations and 300 student members. Each semester, we apply our critical thinking skills and what we are learning in the classroom to deliver solutions to nonprofit organizations in the Champaign-Urbana community and around the world.
SCNO is open to UIUC students of all majors and ages and provides its members with real-world consulting experience, leadership development, and the opportunity to serve others.
Our leadership team is passionate about preserving the values upon which the organization was founded while continually striving to improve the quality of our projects and our member experience.

title: Students for Environmental Concerns
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Agricultural, Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Environmental & Sustainability, Ideology & Politics, Media Arts, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Students for Environmental Concerns (SECS) is the oldest and largest environmental organization at the University of Illinois, dedicated to environmental activism and justice. SECS aims to promote environmental action on campus by spearheading campaigns and collaborating with other organizations on projects that lead to a greener Earth. We believe that all individuals and institutions, particularly those in the Global North, have an important role to play in resolving the current climate crisis. Our primary mission is to work to maintain the stability, integrity, and beauty of the natural world, promote and participate in the sustainable food revolution, and pursue clean energy on and off campus.

title: Students for Fair Democracy
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Ideology & Politics, Law
mission:
Students for Fair Democracy serves to rally students together to strengthen democracy by
bringing ranked choice voting to Champaign-Urbana, and eventually all of Illinois with
the ultimate goal of contributing in the abolition of/aiding in the abolition of the electoral
college, adding term limits to Congress and federal courts, as well as the direct election
of judges. Through this RSO, students will foster relationships with peers and elected
officials and work to bring about positive change in their community as well as fostering
grassroots organizing skills that will last students a lifetime.

title: Students for Socialism and Liberation
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Ideology & Politics
mission:
Our vision of a fair and just society is one without oppression, racism, homophobia,
sexism, ableism, and all other kinds of chauvinism, and we intend to act against these
for the health of our community. SFS will engage in community service, organize political
events, hold discussions regarding various issues including class, the economy, and
racial justice, and will work closely with local organizations and other RSOs to help uplift
our campus, and connect students to the wider community. We will work to nourish
organizational work and experience in both the campus communities and the diverse
working-class communities of Champaign-Urbana. We emphasize that to tackle these
goals, we must work for the development of socialism in the United States and
elsewhere; working on campus with students is the first step in this direction. SFS will
work to provide educational and organizational opportunities in the realm of
anti-imperialist work as well, as such work is deeply important for both the international,
out-of-state, in-state, and local students studying at the University of Illinois.

title: Students Organize for Syria
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture
mission: SOS serves to raise awareness and educate students about ongoing conflicts in Syria, as well as advocate for providing aid and resources to displaced Syrians globally.

title: Students’ Fund
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Student’s Fund serves to create our own portfolio and invest money in U-of-I based-startups through work expected of professional venture capital analysts but instead done by the analysts of The Students’ Fund. Members will conduct due diligence on startups through pitches featuring U-of-I startups. We aim to create an environment where startups can pitch their ideas and products and our team of student analysts can vet, invest, and guide them through the process of becoming a full-fledged startup on campus and beyond. We will assist U-of-I startups with acquiring additional funding through the Cozad New Venture Challenge, IVenture, and more. The Students’ Fund will also provide opportunities for networking with popular venture capital firms like Y Combinator, Sequioa Capital, Andreesen Horowitz for our startups and student analysts.

title: STYL Project
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Media Arts, Performance Arts
mission:
The purpose of the STYL Project shall be to establish a foundation for individuals
with a passion for fashion. Our goal is to provide access to resources, expert guidance, and
valuable connections for individuals looking to pursue a career in fashion design and branding,
or enhance their interest in the field. Through our inclusive social media platform, we will
increase visibility and foster a community of like-minded individuals and entrepreneurs. Our
objective is to create a dynamic and inclusive atmosphere that cultivates the shared passion for
fashion, and acts as a launch pad for brands and individuals to enter the world of fashion.
STYL Project is willing to abide by all University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
policies and guidelines, especially relating to on or off campus activities which our organization
may sponsor or in which we may participate.
membership_benefits:
Joining the STYL Project Student Organization opens up a world of creativity, fashion, and community engagement. As a member, you’ll have the unique opportunity to craft new products such as phone charms, t-shirts, home decorations, and other stylish handmade items. Whether you're an experienced creator or just starting out, this is a space to explore your creative side and develop hands-on crafting skills while working on exciting projects.
Beyond crafting, being part of STYL connects you with like-minded individuals who share a passion for fashion and design. You’ll build friendships, collaborate on projects, and exchange style inspirations with others who appreciate self-expression through fashion. Additionally, you’ll expand your crafting knowledge, learning new techniques and DIY methods to enhance your skills. Our thrifting events are another exciting perk—swap out your wardrobe for fresh looks while also giving back to the community by donating clothes to those in need. By joining STYL, you’re not only embracing creativity but also supporting sustainable fashion and making a positive impact!

title: Sudden Cardiac-Death Awareness Research Foundation: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
The Sudden Cardiac-Death Awareness Research Foundation: University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Chapter aims to give passionate individuals the chance to participate in healthcare
innovation and research projects specifically focused on the area of Cardiac diseases. Specifically,
we hope to focus this research and innovation on heart disease and cardiac arrests. We are also
dedicated to the professional and career development of our members. We want to give members
a chance not only to hear from professionals in the healthcare field but also to build skills,
including networking, communication, public speaking, and analysis through a research
symposium at the end of each semester, where students will be given a chance to present their
healthcare innovations. We hope to collaborate with other healthcare, engineering, and
philanthropic R.S.O.s on campus to organize coordinated events that would benefit all members.
In addition to skill development, our educational initiatives include public awareness campaigns
and informational cardiac health and prevention events. We will continuously spearhead
fundraising efforts to donate to the original chapter of S.C.A.R.F., which uses the money to aid
AED provisions. Our fundraising initiatives will support the original chapter of S.C.A.R.F. and aim
to increase the accessibility and awareness of Automated External Defibrillators (AEDs) in our
community, enhancing emergency cardiac care readiness.
membership_benefits:
- Present research at research symposiums
- Work on research articles in hopes to publish in undergraduate journals or larger peer-reviewed
journals
- Help eradicate sudden cardiac death by fundraising for A.E.D. donations
- Have access to career-building workshops
- Attend guest speaker events with speakers ranging from physicians to industry professionals
- Represent S.C.A.R.F. at the University of Illinois

title: Supply Chain Management Association an ASCM Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The Supply Chain Management Association, an ASCM chapter, seeks to promote continuous learning of recent advancements in the supply chain industry, foster relationships between students and industry leaders, and provide members with the tools and skills to excel in their future careers.

title: Sustainable Solutions
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: To challenge students to develop a stronger understanding of sustainability and learn to incorporate sustainable solutions into everyday problems that engineers may encounter through an annual project that will be in competition and ASCE’s Region 3 competition every spring.

title: Synton Amateur Radio Club
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
Promotion of an active interest in amateur radio communications, equipment, and operation of club
station W9YH for University of Illinois students, and furtherance of public service.

title: Taiwanese American Students Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: The Taiwanese American Students Club serves the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign community and is committed to fostering a welcoming environment that promotes and educates Taiwanese culture and issues.

title: Taiwanese Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Identity & Culture
mission: The purpose of the Taiwanese Student Association is to serve and connect the Taiwanese Community at Champaign-Urbana Region, especially Taiwanese Students and faculty of UIUC.
membership_benefits: Members who joined the Taiwanese student association will be holding events together for the greater Taiwanese community at UIUC.

title: TAMID Group at Illinois
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The TAMID Group at Illinois, serving as the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign chapter, is committed to cultivating the next generation of business leaders. The organization accomplishes its mission by integrating the next generation of entrepreneurs and business professionals with Israel through a comprehensive education curriculum, pro-bono consulting for Israeli startups, capital market investment research, and a summer internship program in Israel.

title: Tamil Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: Tamil Club serves to help connect and promote the Tamil community on the UIUC campus as well as its allies. It exists to provide a space for Tamils, and for anyone interested in Tamil culture to get together to foster a safe and encouraging community.

title: Tau Beta Pi Engineering Honor Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Honorary, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Our mission is to recognize those who have achieved distinguished scholarship and exemplary character as students in engineering, or by their attainments as alumni in the field of engineering. We provide leadership and professional development training for engineering students and alumni members and promote lifelong alumnus member involvement cultivating a community of dedicated high achievers.

title: Tau Kappa Epsilon Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: To aid men in their mental moral and social development for life.
membership_benefits: Life long learning, leadership, brotherhood, personal worth and character, growth, financial success

title: Taylor Swift Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: To serve as a forum for all University of Illinois students who are fans of Taylor Swift to gather and discuss the music and actions of Taylor Swift.

title: Tea & Company
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: Tea & Company is organized to provide members with a place to gather and hang out with other members while eating snacks and drinking tea if the situation allows for it to be done.

title: TEDxUIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Performance Arts, Humanities
mission: To inspire, connect, and empower the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign community through the sharing of ideas worth spreading, fostering intellectual curiosity and promoting positive change.
membership_benefits:
1. Exclusive access to TEDxUIUC events
2. Networking opportunities with speakers and fellow members
3. Priority registration for TEDx talks and workshops
4. Opportunity to contribute ideas and help shape future events
5. Access to a community of innovative thinkers and doers

title: Telugu Student Sangam of Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: B: Mission- The Mission of this RSO is to get students of the same language background together to tell them that they too have a place and friends to connect to. There have been situations in the past in this university for me where it was easier for me to connect to people on the basis of language but there have been people, I have connected with who said they couldn’t find anyone on campus with similar background as theirs’s.
membership_benefits: Get to meet anyone and everyone from the same language background. And you're at a bonus if you've started this college journey without any prior friends with you. Because Memu Unnamu Ga!

title: Thai Student Association
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Identity & Culture, International, Social & Leisure
mission: The Thai Student Association serves as an ambassador for Thailand and its unique cultures. The Thai Student Association aims to bring together people who share the same passion for and interests in Thai culture. The organization will also spread awareness of Thai culture to the University of Illinois community through a variety of events.
membership_benefits:
Membership Benefits- Members of Thai Student Association will have the following benefits within the organization:
1) Members have the right to vote in the yearly board member elections.
2) All members of the organization have the right to propose event ideas to the board
for consideration.

title: The American Chemical Society East Central Illinois Women Chemists Committee
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences
mission:
The mission of the UIUC-WCC follows those described by the national American Chemical Society Women Chemists Committee: “The Women Chemists Committee (WCC) serves the membership of the American Chemical Society. Our mission is to be leaders in attracting, developing, promoting, and advocating for women in the chemical sciences in order to positively impact society and the profession. There are four goals designed to fulfill the mission statement: 1) Increase participation and retention of women in the chemical sciences and related disciplines; 2) Take an advocacy position within the ACS on issues of importance to women in the chemical sciences; 3) Provide leadership for career development opportunities for women in the chemical sciences and related disciplines; 4) Promote and recognize the professional accomplishments of women in the chemical sciences and related disciplines.”
In addition, the UIUC-WCC will: 1) Serve as a liaison between women chemists and the Department of Chemistry at UIUC; 2) Provide social opportunities for women chemists, in addition to social opportunities for the entire Department of Chemistry; and 3) Develop outreach programs for all chemists in the process of developing career goals and establishing themselves in the field.

title: The Baha'i Association at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: The purpose of this association shall be to further the tenets of the Bahá'í Faith, to invite those interested to investigate the Faith for themselves; to promote the unity of mankind; and to foster understanding, love and fellowship on this campus by sponsoring such things as lectures, information tables, service projects, discussions, informal gatherings, social activities and public meetings. This association shall not endorse any partisan or political group on a campus level or otherwise.

title: The Blading Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The Blading Illini's works to provide a community for Beyblade enthusiasts at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

title: The Boring Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The Boring Illini serves to empower future engineers and innovators by developing groundbreaking and impactful tunneling solutions, while providing exceptional hands-on learning experiences.

title: The Canopy Club Connectors
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Canopy Club Connectors works as an independent student group that has strong interests towards The Canopy Club in Urbana, IL. As a student fan base for those interested in the world of music entertainment, we strive to attain diversity in regards to music and creative means for college students at The University of Illinois. We are committed to showcasing the value of live entertainment in the C-U community! This registered student organization will work to gather students interested in music, creativity, media, and performance as a collective group that allows the fluid discussion of these topics alongside spreading the word about an amazing music venue in C-U!
membership_benefits: The ability to network with a group of students who have a desire to get involved in the music/entertainment industry, and also directly interact with members of the professional community hosting concerts and events in town. Plus entry into events at the Canopy Club, free of charge.

title: The Classics Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Honorary
mission: The Classics Club strives to appreciate Greco-Roman history and culture, and provide a space for the discussion of the ancient world. We hope to be inclusive of all students, regardless of race, religion, sex, or creed, and acknowledge that the classics are for everyone to read and learn from.
membership_benefits: There is no fee to join nor any requirements, just an interest in the Classics- we are open to all majors and students. Feel free to come to the meetings that interest you and be part of a community of Classics-nerds and scholars.

title: The Collective Magazine
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: The Collective Magazine is an arts RSO focused on spotlighting and celebrating local artists in the Champaign-Urbana community. Our main objective is to work collaboratively to produce a magazine every semester that showcases the work of local artists and musicians. We also host a variety of events with the goal of bringing like minded individuals together!

title: The Cooking Collective
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: The Cooking Collective welcomes student cooks, chefs, and food-enthusiasts of all skill levels to join us in lively social events, interactive workshops, and enriching cultural exchanges. Our mission is to cultivate an inclusive and enjoyable environment where members can learn, collaborate, and form meaningful connections while sharing in the joy of cooking. Through these shared experiences, we strive to empower students to develop confidence and resourcefulness in the kitchen, igniting a lifelong passion for homemade cuisine.

title: The Creative Collective
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Performance Arts
mission:
The Creative Collective is a group of creative RSOs at UIUC who have come
together to support each other in all of our endeavors! We help RSOs organize their activities
and advertise them to potential new members! Another goal is to foster collaboration between
the RSOs and the members in ways that are novel and cross disciplinary.

title: The Diabetes Link
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness
mission: The Link aims to empower students with Type 1 Diabetes through community, advocacy, and education. Our mission is to provide a supportive network that fosters connections, promotes awareness, and equips members with the resources and knowledge to thrive in both their personal and academic lives.

title: The Dressember Organization of the University of Illinois at Urbana Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism
mission: To fight against human trafficking while building a supportive, engaging community for all club members.

title: The Emerald Illini, Irish Dance Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission: The Emerald Illini serves to share and appreciate Irish culture through the art of Irish dance and create a community of dancers made up of individuals of any level and background.

title: The Fashion Network
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Fashion Network is a Registered Student Organization (RSO) at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. TFN follows the rules as outlined by the University’s RSO office, including that TFN is open to all students at the University. TFN is committed to fostering creative collaboration between individuals and groups interested in fashion on campus and in the community.

title: The Financial Planning Club at Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The purpose of this organization is to help students gain insight into the Financial Planning profession by networking with professionals in the field.

title: The Gray Matters at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Health & Wellness
mission:
The Gray Matters at UIUC serves to educate, build community, and bring
mental health awareness to anyone and everyone who needs it. Most importantly, we are
working to create a world without suicide. We want to empower students, and others to have the tools and knowledge to be mental health advocates and make a real difference in our world.

title: The Hemp Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Agricultural, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Health & Human Sciences
mission:
The purposes of this organization are:
1. To educate the University community on the Cannabis industry and Cannabis-derived
products.
2. To provide fellowship among students and faculty particularly relating to professional
relations in the Cannabis industry and ancillary sectors.
3. To represent student needs and wants regarding information about the cannabis industry
and networking.
4. To provide a forum for the presentation of innovative ideas to benefit the University
community

title: The Illini Metagamers
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Social & Leisure
mission: The Illini Metagamers is a registered student organization (RSO) at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC), whose purpose is to provide a community space to engage in tabletop activities such as role-playing games, board games, card games, video games, and any other such activity.
membership_benefits:
Being a part of the Illini Metagamers means you'll be a part of one of the largest tabletop gaming communities. You get to partake in our year-long Dungeons and Dragons Club Campaign, and you will also be able to meet new friends who share your interests!
Tabletop gaming!

title: The Illini Swing Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Identity & Culture, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Illini Swing Society's purpose is to promote the education and enjoyment of various swing dance styles within the community of Champaign-Urbana. We hold dances, organize workshops, and offer lessons in Lindy Hop, Balboa, Solo Jazz, Collegiate Shag, and Charleston.

title: The Illinois Alt. Protein Project
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability
mission:
The UIUC Alt. Protein Project is inspiring the next generation of scientists and entrepreneurs to build healthy, sustainable, and just food systems for alternative
protein research and innovation.

title: The Illinois Law Academy
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission:
The ILA aims to prepare and encourage promising student candidates for futures in
public policy, justice, and law by offering real-world connections, hands-on experience, and
discussion with peers regarding various topic relating to law and policy.

title: The Illinois Student Undergraduate Research Journal
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction
mission: ILSURJ is a student-run, multidisciplinary research journal. Our goal is to build bridges between undergraduate and graduate students, faculty among varying disciplines, and the public. Through our peer-edited, faculty-reviewed electronic and print publications, we strive to develop and display the work produced by our high-achieving undergraduate researchers in all academic disciplines in the spirit of development towards professional research. We aim to inspire interest in research and individual curiosity throughout the student body, faculty, and surrounding community.

title: The Jewish Engineering Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Jewish Engineering Society serves as a support system which aims to nurture engineering students at UIUC as they grow as engineers and Jews. This can be done through communal, social, technical, and academic events, all of which can expose students to various fields of engineering and STEM as a whole while helping students build a Jewish community in the field they can rely on.
membership_benefits:
1) Voting rights on votes posed to the club
2) Ability to travel with RSO
3) Free admission to RSO events

title: The Kat Walk
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
T.K.W. Modeling Agency (RSO) provides various modeling experiences/opportunities! We are constantly exploring runway, print photography, model coaching, social outreach, events, and more! All services and opportunities are planned with creativity, and mirror the experience of a professional business entity such as T.K.W. Modeling Agency LLC.
As a registered student organization, The Kat Walk is in deep connection with various Universities; including our own college community, students, and administration. As an organization we continue to develop in the college realm, but we are an organization of models who can be recognized all over the world, and on other college campuses. Pushing forward we will infuse ourselves into the modeling industry, seeking the opportunity to shine while pursuing educational/occupational goals!
The Kat Walk is open to ALL aspiring models interested in gaining elite modeling skills. Modeling experience/skill are taught and required for participation as a model in T.K.W; there will be continuous opportunities for models to gain as much additional modeling experience as they desire. We boost confidence in our diverse models, providing a larger platform for models!

title: The King's Guard
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Athletic & Recreation, Social & Leisure
mission:
The King’s Guard seeks to promote and generate social acceptance of The Kingfisher as the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign’s unofficial mascot. Our goals are to:
1. Create an inclusive fan community on campus, and
2. Work to engage with RSOs, and
3. Promote and participate in pep for campus sports teams, and
4. Pursue the respectful portrayal of native groups on and off campus, including holding the
university accountable for its historical participation in this issue, and
5. Advocate for the adoption of The Kingfisher as the official mascot of UIUC

title: The Latine Social Work Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Identity & Culture, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission:
The mission of the Latine Social Work Organization puts social work values such as service,
social justice, cultural competency, empathy, and more into action. Additionally, we believe in sharing social work values with students from all majors. We practice social work values through our four committees- Activism & Advocacy, Mental Health, Community Outreach, and Alumni Support.
membership_benefits: Any student enrolled at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign who believes in the mission of the Latino Social Work Organization and upholds its value is welcome and considered a member of the Latino Social Work Organization. Members may be undergraduate or graduate students and must be members of advocates for the Latinx community. Members are encouraged to participate meaningfully and actively in the organization; however, members are free to come and go as they please.

title: The Manga, Manhwa, and Manhua Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The ‘The Manga, Manhwa, and Manhua club’ serves to promote, nurture, and support interests in a few select forms of graphic novel literature, which include Mangas, Manhwas, Manhuas, Webtoons, Webcomics, Comics, along with other forms of literature such as Japanese Light Novels, and Web Novels, which are related to Mangas, Manhwas, and Manhuas by having the same storytelling and genre style. Despite what the name indicates, the club welcomes all forms of graphic literature.

title: The National Organization of Minority Architecture Students
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Our vision consists of promoting and celebrating diversity and excellence within the architectural and environmental design field. As an inclusive collective of students of all ethnic, national, and religious backgrounds, our mission is to collaborate, learn, and share ideas to elicit success in individual and group endeavors.
membership_benefits:
Exclusive scholarships, event opportunities, collaborations, and extensive I-NOMA Network.
Educational Programming and Networking Events through our Committees
Mentor youth and Volunteer at the Project Pipeline Summer Camp
Access to events such as the NextGen initiative. The subject of each NextGen event is planned by the student chapters with the support and mentorship of I-NOMA. These events aim to create opportunities for all of the student chapters to come together for networking and to enhance their leadership skills through community engagement and discussions on identity and design.

title: The National Society of Pershing Rifles
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Community Service & Philanthropy, Veteran & Military Connected
mission: The mission of the Pershing Rifles, Company Delta-1, is to aid in developing successful officers in the Army, Navy, and Air Force, and to foster camaraderie among ROTC and civilian students at UIUC. We are committed to upholding the traditions and values of the United States Military while offering civilians the opportunity to experience military structure and brotherhood without a formal service commitment. Through elite-level tactics and drill training, members gain discipline, precision, and a sense of unity that prepares them for both military and civilian leadership.
membership_benefits:
Professional & Leadership Development
Military Drill & Tactical Excellence
Camaraderie & Brotherhood
Personal Growth & Resilience
Networking & Mentorship

title: The Other Guys
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: Since their inception during the 1968-1969 school year as a subset of the University of Illinois' Varsity Men's Glee Club, The Other Guys have evolved from an amusing diversion to a popular, high profile, international traveling group of goodwill ambassadors for the University of Illinois’ School of Music. The current group continues to build on the tradition – a tradition characterized by musicianship, comedic spontaneity, and time-honored dignity.

title: The Philanthropic Playlist
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: The purpose of The Philanthropic Playlist shall be to create musical experiences for UIUC students and foster a love for music in our community, while donating 100% of proceeds to health organizations. The chapter shall promote membership in The Philanthropic Playlist by acquainting the student body with the ideas, purposes, and objectives of TPP.

title: The Phoenix Improv Company
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: The Phoenix Improv Company serves as the University of Illinois' experimental Improv company. The group focuses on long form improv while also exploring alternate forms and executions.

title: The Prancing Pearls
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: The Prancing Pearls is a majorette style dance team that promotes community service, student retention, physical/mental health, and nurtures leadership skills. We strive to build a community of dancers that support one another and are connected with their campus community. We intend to perform for the community and the campus at athletic events, cultural houses, etc. We will connect with our community through community service and engaging events.
membership_benefits:
- Voting rights
- Ability to travel with with RSO
- Free Admission to RSO events

title: The Reclamationist Party
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Ideology & Politics, Social & Leisure, Humanities
mission: The Reclamationist Party serves to provide students a political alternative to the two-party system that works in a united union to reform the United States' Democracy in favor of the populace. Hoping to pave the way to a new form of governance that includes all citizens of these States and serves no one person. This may only be accomplished by us looking inwards, focusing collective efforts to improving the lives of our community, the lives of our friends, and the lives of our families. Striving for liberté, égalité, fraternité across the world, with a united voice.
membership_benefits:
+ Voting Rights – w/ ability to proxy vote
+ Help dictate RSO Volunteerism Events
+ Free admission to RSO events
+ Have access to campaign aide
+ Ability to travel with RSO

title: The Red Shoe Foundation
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy
mission:
The purposes of The Red Shoe Foundation are:
1. To provide a wish for those in care facilities (specifically nursing homes) by getting to know what one thing they have always wanted in life is and providing that thing to them to the best of our ability. Pending that the item they request is not achievable by our foundation, we will find another item or experience that may not be as prominent but will still bring joy into their life.
2. To provide patients with a group of students to be able to talk to and form deeper relationships with through the practice of continued visitation. Our ultimate goal is to improve the lives of those we meet with through both our actions and words.

title: The Reel Readers Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Social & Leisure
mission: The Reel Readers Society serves to form a community of undergraduate students passionate about exploring the connections between literature and film. We seek to engage in thoughtful discussions, examining how stories in books are transformed on screen, while fostering a relaxed and inclusive environment where members can share their love for both book and film.

title: The Resurrected Poets Society International
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - International
mission: The Resurrected Poets Society seeks to bridge the literary traditions of the East and West, fostering a deeper exploration across cultures. It will examine all types of poetry from different traditions and countries, including in different languages, both ancient and contemporary. The association will also examine and study figures of philosophy, poets, novelists, and quotes of wisdom. Our mission is to uncover the universal truths that unite us. This will be done through collaboration events with other cultural groups and associations on campus, guest speaker invitations, poetry contests and prizes, field trips and traveling to literature sights and museums, attending national and international conferences, and through hosting events like gala nights. In the spirit of inclusion and creativity, we invite all who share a passion for poetry, literature, philosophy, and the pursuit of wisdom to join us in this noble endeavor.

title: The Scholarly Reading Circle For Economics at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Ideology & Politics, Law, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Scholarly Reading Circle for Economics at UIUC serves as a space for students interested in the field of economics to explore and discuss an array of fun and interesting research papers or articles that they might not otherwise encounter in coursework. Members will have the opportunity to give a presentation on any research articles or papers that strike their interest, listen to other members’ perspectives, and network with their intellectually curious peers.
membership_benefits: Members will be able to practice public speaking, critical thinking and discussion, and be exposed to different fields of interest that have economic implications on society.

title: The Slavic Graduate Student Association
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Humanities
mission: The Slavic Graduate Student Association is an organization for graduate students in the field of Slavic, East European, and Eurasian area studies to come together and connect with fellow colleagues to forge a closer academic community on campus. Historically the SGSA has been limited to graduate students of the Department of Slavic Languages and Literatures, however moving forward we welcome any graduate student who is actively working in this field. The SGSA also advocates for graduate student wellbeing within the Slavic Languages and Literatures Department through a faculty liaison who communicates with the faculty about graduate student life and reports back to the organization about faculty choices. While the SGSA cannot have a presence in every department represented in this organization, we will provide a space where graduate students can come together and create a stronger community.

title: The Storybook Collective
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Media Arts
mission: The Storybook Collective is a student-led nonprofit organization dedicated to distributing original children’s books created by UIUC Students. Members will collaborate to write, illustrate, and distribute books free of charge to children in the Champaign-Urbana community.

title: The Technology and Management Student Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Community Service & Philanthropy, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: To holistically enrich the experience of past, present, and prospective cohorts of a prestigious minor at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign

title: The Wildlife Society, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign Student Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Environmental & Sustainability
mission:
The Wildlife Society exists to
- Promote opportunities for improved communication among individual members locally and with other student chapters, the Illinois Chapter, the North Central Section, and the Wildlife Society.
- Enhance the education opportunities particularly for students in Natural Resources and Environmental Sciences, Integrative Biology, Animal Sciences, and the Graduate Program for Ecology, Evolution, and Conservation Biology at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
- Prepare members for careers in wildlife biology, conservation, and management.
- Encourage professionalism and high standards of scholarship.
- Foster campus and community awareness of wildlife issues.
membership_benefits: Members will gain hands-on experience with many wildlife species, and they will form connections with wildlife professionals and professors.

title: The Women's Network UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Social & Leisure
mission:
The Women’s Network (TWN) was created for ambitious women looking to grow professionally while being lifted by their community. TWN offers opportunities to gain exposure to the professional world, network with high-profile speakers and meet peers around their campus and the country. TWN meets biweekly (twice a month) and holds speaker meetings, various networking events, resume, internship and LinkedIn workshops, alumni networking receptions and interactive activity sessions to develop relationships with fellow members. Our workshops and guest speakers help prepare you for your next steps and may open your eyes to paths you haven't even considered.
Our mission is to create a community of women that celebrates the desire to achieve, cultivating their ambition in order to prepare the next generation of leaders.
membership_benefits:
1. Voting Rights
2. Ability to travel with TWN
3. Free admission to TWN events
4. Eligibility to run for officer roles

title: Themed Entertainment Association at University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The Themed Entertainment Association at The University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign serves to provide students with exposure to the world’s leading creators, developers, designers and producers of compelling places and experiences. In collaboration with the Themed Engineering Association provide students with social events, educational panels, exposure to industry professionals and more.

title: Theta Tau Professional Engineering Fraternity
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Theta Tau's mission is to develop and maintain high standards of professional interest among its members within engineering, and to unite them in a strong bond of fraternal fellowship.

title: Theta Xi Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
membership_benefits:
- Alumni network consisting of over 2,300 UIUC graduates, and 60,000 Theta Xi graduates.
- $2500 scholarship given semesterly to two members.
- A chance to gain experience in leadership positions across many different areas
- Tons of opportunities to gain volunteer hours and participate in service and philanthropic goals
- Ability to learn from peers ranging in all ages, majors, and minors.

title: Thomistic Institute at University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Humanities
mission: The mission of the organization is to foster an intellectual and Catholic ethos at the University of Illinois with an emphasis on the teachings of Thomas Aquinas, primarily by organizing public, on-campus lecture events on the Christian intellectual tradition.

title: Track and Field Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission: The Track and Field Club was founded on the belief that a running program run in the mold of a competitive D-III program would benefit the University and its students by providing exposure for the University, leadership opportunities for students, promoting fitness on campus, and establishing an attitude of achievement that defines the Illini spirit. Student athletes will learn time management and discipline in a safe and nurturing environment where they will be able to call on their teammates for assistance in both their academic and athletic pursuits.

title: Transportation and Development Institute Graduate Student Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
The ASCE T&DI-UIUC is formed with the main purpose of strengthening the professional and extracurricular development of graduate students in transportation engineering specific to the following:
1. Professional Development – through the organization of seminars, technical trips, and related activities with the purpose of providing opportunities for information exchange regarding current transportation research and practice issues;
2. Intra-university Outreach – by increasing awareness of variety of subjects within transportation engineering for current and prospective graduate students and by fostering the engagement and collaboration of transportation engineering graduate students in University activities; and
3. Community Outreach – by promoting awareness of transportation engineering in the Urbana-Champaign community through informative events and by contributing to the betterment of the Urbana-Champaign community, reaching beyond the university with volunteer work that meet societal needs from an engineering perspective.

title: Traveling Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation
mission: To provide safe, accessible, and affordable recreational travel opportunities to students at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
membership_benefits: Valid through the end of the UIUC Spring '25 semester. Access to trip signup, social events, Discord, and more!

title: Triangle Fraternity
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The purpose of Triangle shall be to maintain a fraternity of engineers, architects and scientists. It shall carry out its purpose by establishing chapters that develop balanced men who cultivate high moral character, foster lifelong friendships, and live their lives with integrity.
membership_benefits:
For over 100 years, Triangle Fraternity at UIUC has provided an environment that fosters personal growth and professional success. Our brothers, coming from the disciplines of engineering, architecture, and science, develop long-lasting friendships and connections with a nationwide network of alumni. We are proud of our social and professional structure; Triangle is active in both the Greek and STEM community on campus. Within the Greek community, we host social exchanges with sororities, participate in community service events, spearhead our own philanthropy fundraisers, and have brotherhood membership events such as an annual brotherhood retreat. Within the STEM community, we are active in various competitions and events, network with multiple organizations and professors, and host recruitment and informational sessions with companies.
Our Social-Professional STEM atmosphere allows you to be your best self. Illinois Triangle provides a safe environment to grow and develop as a person and as an engineer, as part of a brotherhood found nowhere else. Our brothers volunteer, build projects, study together, and socialize in our many living and working spaces.

title: True Vine
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: True Vine is a campus organization focused on raising disciples of Jesus who can live sacrificial lives for the gospel and contribute to society and their nation by preaching the gospel of Jesus Christ to college students and young people. True Vine teaches the Bible to college students and young people and helps them to live according to the teachings of the Scriptures and to practice the world mission command of Jesus (Acts 1:8). True Vine focuses on individualized bible study and counseling for students.

title: TRUTH AND BEAUTY
tags:
Orange Student Organization

mission: TRUTH AND BEAUTY is a K-Pop dance group based at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (hereinafter referred to as UIUC) that rehearses, performs, and films various K-Pop dance covers throughout the year. TRUTH AND BEAUTY’s mission is to promote dancers of all backgrounds through K-Pop dance.

-To orient incoming students from Turkiye to the university environment and assist them in their effort to adjust to the new community (i.e. housing and commuting information, airport pickup, etc.).
-To facilitate social and intellectual interaction between members.

tags:

mission: Turning Point USA’s mission is to educate students about the importance of fiscal responsibility, free markets, and capitalism through innovative campus activism and non-partisan, thought-provoking discussion.

title: TVC College
tags:

mission: TVC College exists to see students encounter the love of the Father, experience transformation in Jesus, and learn how to extend the miraculous through the power of the Holy Spirit.

title: Twin City Bible Church Students Organization
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: The purpose of Twin City Bible Church Campus Fellowship is to bridge student life at the U of I for University students with spiritual life in our local church (Twin City Bible Church) right across from campus. We endeavor to broaden spiritual and community experiences for students engaging in Christian Fellowships on campus, as well as those who lack in any spiritual formation and community on campus. Our local church is a congregation committed to spread the Gospel of Jesus Christ, to being a disciple-making community of God's people, to serve as reconciling agents of the Kingdom of God to the world, and in all of this to glorify God by working to fulfill our shared goals in worship, community, and mission.

title: Tzu Chi Collegiate Association

2. To foster a sense of community among our club members
3. To promote morals, strengthen character, instill a spirit of compassion for all, exemplify humility, respect and gentleness in character

title: Udaan
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission: As a National Dance Competition returning for its fourth year, our mission is tightly connected to our slogan: Rise to the Top. This does not just apply to participating teams but also to our competition and anyone or anything working with us. Through Udaan, we hope to maintain the pride that we have in our rich culture along with providing the best platform for all types of dancers. As a competition board, the passion for South Asian culture is very apparent in every individual. Our competition continues to be driven by spirited individuals committed to leaving a mark on the dance community and furthering the idea that Legends Never Die.

mission: The Ukrainian Student Association serves to bring an awareness to Ukrainian culture, traditions, and history on campus; create a forum where Ukrainian subject matters can be openly discussed and heard; and to provide an inclusive community for students with an emphasis on creating an environment of multicultural embracement amongst all members.

title: Undergraduate Law Review at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission:
Foster Discussion: Provide students with opportunities to engage in informed, civil, and meaningful discussions on important legal issues.
Promote Awareness: Shine a light on pressing legal issues by creating an accessible, objective, and informative law & policy journal based on thorough and accurate research.
Provide Experience: Allow undergraduates at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign to gain experience conducting legal research and writing law & policy articles.

title: Undergraduate Neuroscience Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission: The purpose of the Undergraduate Neuroscience Society (UNS) is to promote and develop neuroscience opportunities on campus and engage undergraduate students in neuroscience-related discussions. The chapter shall promote membership in the UNS by acquainting the student body with the ideas, purposes, and objectives of UNS.

title: Undergraduate Pre-PhD Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Life & Physical Sciences, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
The Undergraduate Pre-PhD Society (UPS) serves to provide undergraduate Pre-PhD
students resources to better prepare them for PhD programs and exposure to the skills typical
PhD students will need to learn such as grant writing, proposals, fellowships, and more.
membership_benefits: Members gain essential skills to help with their PhD process as well as forging connections with other Pre-PhD students from different fields.

title: Undergraduate Psychology Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Behavioral Sciences
mission:
The UPA is dedicated to the service of all students with an interest in psychology, and seeks to serve its members through hosting events and panels with academics and professionals in the field, connecting students with relevant academic and career resources on campus and beyond, preparing students for life beyond their undergraduate studies by hosting resume/cover letter and networking workshops, hosting social events, and organizing volunteering opportunities. In short, the UPA’s primary mission is to help its members achieve excellence on campus while preparing them for the world beyond their undergraduate studies.
UPA is associated with Psi Chi, an honors society for high-achieving students in the field of psychology. To note, not all members of the UPA are members of Psi Chi, and vice versa.

title: Undergraduate Research in Scientific Advancement
tags:
