mission: URSA serves is a student-run program that connects freshmen and sophomores with graduate students for semester-long research projects. Our goal is to provide a portal for incoming students to take part in undergraduate research for the first time.

title: UNICEF at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: The purpose of this organization is to organize students for the survival, protection and development of children worldwide through education, advocacy and fundraising as a UNICEF Campus Initiative group through the U.S. Fund for UNICEF

title: United Church of Christ Campus Ministry
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Faith, Religion & Spirituality
mission: UCC Campus Ministry is a student-focused progressive Christian organization that walks with students as they explore questions of faith and life; cultivate a commitment to service; grow individually and in community; connect with each other, caring adults, and the wider world; and launch into the world looking for a community of faith to which they can belong

title: United Greek Council
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: The United Greek Council was established in 2003, and serves as the council for 24 cultural Sororities and Fraternities. Our goal is to promote culture, enhance personal and professional development, maintain a strong focus on service and provide an emphasis on academic excellence in higher education through programming and collaborative events.

title: University YMCA Student Board
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: The University YMCA Student Board serves to foster a relationship and collaboration between Y-RSOs, Y-students, Y-community, and the campus community.

title: Untitled Musical Improv Co
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The Untitled Musical Improv Co (UMIC) serves as the University of Illinois' school of short-form musical improv. UMIC seeks to educate improvisers with a background in tiered-team style long-form improv and maintain a welcoming, inclusive, passionate, and safe environment to learn and perform musical improv. To successfully coach less experienced musical improvisers, UMIC has its more experienced members lead, teach, and coach its less experienced members through traditions passed down by word of mouth, written word, historical/archival video content, etc. UMIC seeks to utilize a plethora of musical instruments to accompany musical improvisers to create a diverse and fruitful musical improvisation experience. UMIC strives to give existing improvisers a way to perform their art musically in a dedicated and sustainable format.

title: UpliftED
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness
mission: upliftED serves as a platform for college students to help underprivileged youth overcome educational hurdles by providing essential resources, mentorship, and engaging activities. Through partnerships with schools, orphanages, and community organizations, we aim to create a positive impact by offering backpack drives, meal kits, other necessities, and fun, interactive events. Our goal is to empower the next generation of learners while giving college students the opportunity to make a real difference, gain volunteer experience, and develop leadership skills.

title: Varsity Men's Glee Club at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: The purpose of the Varsity Men’s Glee Club is to uphold the tradition of excellence that has been set forth by its members since 1886 by selecting and singing a wide variety of music for men’s voices and sharing and connecting through music with both local and global communities.

title: VAW Global Veterinary Outreach
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Health & Wellness, Identity & Culture, International, Life & Physical Sciences, Veterinary
mission:
VAW Global Health Alliances develops community health systems while providing interns the opportunity to work alongside experienced local healthcare professionals. VAW Global Veterinary Interns work closely with community partners to implement veterinary clinics, as well as provide assistance to existing animal shelters, across low- and middle-income countries (LMICs). In the Veterinary Outreach program, interns learn about healthcare in a global context. Through shadowing local veterinarians, interns will also learn about veterinary procedures, treatment courses, clinic operations, vaccinations, and deworming.
Interns will prepare for their trip throughout the year by attending team training sessions, participating in local community service projects, and developing team building activities, led by their Team Leader or Faculty Team Leader. Interns are required to attend trainings and workshops prior to their trip, so that they are well prepared upon arrival in country.
This is an intensive internship — valuable to future veterinarians, veterinary assistants, veterinary technicians, as well as other future healthcare providers, global practitioners, and anyone interested in gaining skills in public health while supporting healthcare systems around the world.

title: Velocity Dance
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: The primary purpose of Velocity Dance is to bring together dancers with different dance backgrounds to perform together as a team.

title: Venture Capital Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business
mission: The Venture Capital Association’s purpose is to provide students interested in venture capital with exposure to the industry through education as well as real-world experience. VC funds leverage the organization’s resources for consultancy on both potential and existing investments. In order to provide value to our partners, VCA analysts must be trained on how to think like an investor, perform analysis, and produce high-quality deliverables. Analysts are formally trained in their first semester through a bootcamp phase by the Membership Director on a curriculum specifically designed for VCA, which includes weekly meetings, events with other organizations in the entrepreneurial ecosystem, guest speakers, and more. Analysts who are interested in moving to the “Associate Program” are staffed on projects in which they gain real-world experience working for a VC to either perform industry research, source investment opportunities, conduct due diligence, or consult on a portfolio company. These types of projects are outlined in the “Project Management Outline” section. Associates work hand-in-hand under a project manager. Every partner is assigned at least one project manager to serve as the point of contact and to oversee project completion. Through the efforts outlined above, VCA strives to create a unique pipeline into the venture capital industry for the brightest students at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

title: Veterinarians as One Inclusive Community for Empowerment
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Veterinary
mission:
The purpose of VOICE is:
To increase awareness, respect and sensitivity to differences among all individuals and communities in the field of veterinary medicine These include, but are not limited to, sex, race, color, age, national origin, religion, disability, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/reassignment, gender expression, citizenship, pregnancy or parental status, veteran or military status, and educational background
To celebrate diversity within the profession of veterinary medicine and provide a campus environment that embraces diversity and promotes the success of students, particularly underrepresented students
To promote the importance of cross-cultural awareness in veterinary medicine in order to meet the needs of our diversifying clientele
To promote the veterinary profession, provide leadership and mentorship to any youth, particularly underrepresented youth, interested in careers in veterinary medicine

title: Video Game Music Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission:
The VGMC serves as the place for different musicians and players to meet up with one another to create music from various video game series. Member will meet amongst one another to gather in a small group and create a small ensemble. The goal here is to share and express ourselves with our musical abilities and gaming passion within ourselves, and people around us.
If you are interested here is the discord server:
https://discord.gg/evKz48XbjF

title: Vietnamese Student Association
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: The Vietnamese Student Association is an organization dedicated to promoting cultural awareness through a variety of events on campus and in the Urbana-Champaign community. VSA strives to establish a supportive environment for those of Vietnamese and non-Vietnamese descent to interact and engage in activities that preserve and appreciate the Vietnamese culture and heritage. VSA is open to everyone that is interested in learning or sharing Vietnamese culture.

title: Virtual Reality Club at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission:
The purpose of the VR Club at UIUC is to aid club members in learning about and having fun with VR by hosting opportunities to play, explore, and learn. Opportunities we host are broken up into the following 3 categories and overlap as such: VRClub, MiXR, VR eSports.
We host open hours weekly to play exciting VR games and meet new people. Our themed open hours feature a new specific VR experience or game every week for everyone to try out. We decide the specific event for open hours weekly so there is always something new for people to try out. MiXR (Meetings involving Extended Reality) is an academic forum hosted every week. We invite academics, researchers, professors, and interested students to join in to discuss topics every week regarding extended reality technology and the metaverse. The discussions range from research presentations to roundtable conversations. The VR Esports team competes in the Collegiate VR Esports League (CVRE League) against colleges across the nation. The team is flexible to include multiple different games, depending on what is offered through CVRE.

title: Vis-A-Vis Tutoring
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction
mission: Vis-A-Vis Tutoring serves to provide an opportunity for enthusiastic and dedicated University of Illinois students to tutor children one-on-one or be a classroom aide in the local Champaign-Urbana elementary, middle, and high schools. email askvisavis@gmail.com

title: Vitality Dance Team
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: TO UPHOLD THE NAME AND REPUTATION OF VITALITY DANCE TEAM FOR THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS WHILE CREATING A SAFE SPACE TO DANCE AND BOND WITH OTHER MEMBERS OF GREEK LIFE.

title: Volunteer Illini Projects
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy
mission: Volunteer Illini Projects, Inc. (VIP) is a student-run, student-staffed volunteer organization committed to peace, unity and change. By working with and within the community, VIP makes a positive impact through service, thereby enriching students’ educational experiences and committing students to a lifetime of volunteerism. VIP strives to foster unity and enhance interpersonal connections through mutual understanding and empowerment. The dynamic tradition of past student initiative and vision for positive social action guides the future of Volunteer Illini Projects, Inc.

title: WeAreSAATH
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism
mission:
WE ARE SAATH is dedicated to fostering a supportive, culturally sensitive, and
inclusive environment that raises awareness about mental health, specifically within South Asian communities. We aim to reduce the stigma surrounding mental health through advocacy, education, and community support, distinguishing our approach from similar organizations by focusing on cultural conversations and accessible peer-to-peer support. Our mission emphasizes not only raising awareness but also providing grassroots, actionable support through localized cultural dialogues, accessible resources, and platforms that celebrate the diversity within South Asian mental health experiences.

title: weDignify-UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Ideology & Politics
mission: weDignify-UIUC’s purpose is to promote and defend the dignity of all human life, from conception to natural death. We envision college campuses to be centers for a culture of life where people treat life with love, new life is welcomed with joy, and people suffering from abortion are led to healing hope.

title: Wesley Foundation Student Fellowship
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Faith, Religion & Spirituality, Health & Wellness
mission: The Wesley Student Center is a theologically progressive, inclusive, and affirming campus ministry offering space for students to meet new people, explore faith, and engage in social justice as we transform our lives, our community, and the world!
membership_benefits: The Wesley Student Center is proud to offer many community-building activities and spaces for students at the University of Illinois of Urbana-Champaign. From free coffee at the Etc. Coffeehouse, study sessions at the Student Lounge, Midweek Worship out by the campfire, to movie nights at our theater, there's something at Wesley for everyone!

title: What You Will Theatre Company
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: What You Will Theatre Company presents the works of William Shakespeare, his contemporaries, and other relevant productions in a humanistic and accessible light. Through student-produced Shakespeare we are there to provide a bridge between the Early Modern period and today’s contemporary audiences by entertaining as well as challenging our audiences to explore inner truths of humanity and of themselves.

title: Women Impacting Supply Chain Excellence
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, International, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The mission of WISE is to empower students interested in studying or pursuing a career in supply chain management through networking, personal and professional development, leadership skills, and industry knowledge.
membership_benefits:
By becoming a member of WISE, you gain access to career growth opportunities and a strong network of women in the supply chain industry. Members enjoy exclusive workshops, sponsor presentations, mentorship, and guidance to overcome industry challenges.
WISE also provides leadership opportunities, such as joining committees, taking an Exec position, and advocating for women in the supply chain industry. Some members may attend the WISE National Symposium to network with industry leaders, explore job opportunities, and learn about supply chain innovations.

title: Women in Aerospace
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: WIA serves to promote and maintain women's interests in the field of aerospace engineering. WIA also aims to provide a supportive resource for current and prospective female aerospace engineers and foster a sense of community for women in the aerospace engineering department here at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign through social, professional, and networking events. WIA is also a chapter of the Women of Aeronautics and Astronautics (WoAA) committee within the American Institute of Aeronautics and Astronautics (AIAA) but maintains internal independence.

title: Women In Architecture-UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: The mission of Women in Architecture (WIA) is to cultivate and promote the development and leadership of women design professionals by providing a forum for empowering, networking, and mentoring to enhance the architectural community. Though we are a student organization, we also connect with the larger organization in Chicago to present different networking opportunities with working professionals.

title: Women in Chemical Sciences
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Life & Physical Sciences, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
WiCS Exists to:
(1) Provide a community designed specifically focussed on inclusion and support for those who identify as women within the school of chemical sciences
(2) Provide professional development and support for advancement of members including but not-limited to mentorship, interaction and exposure to research topics and job opportunities. (3) Prepare women for the difficulties often encountered in male-dominated workplaces and academic environments. Provide an ongoing and active alumni network to maintain a support structure for current and former student
(4) Advance efforts of inclusivity both within and without the school of chemical science to encourage the advancement of women and BIPOC peoples in the chemical sciences

title: Women in Civil and Environmental Engineering
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
The Women in CEE RSO serves to empower tomorrow’s innovators. It provides
professional support to unite women and non-male identifying individuals in civil
engineering and is dedicated to creating an inclusive community by collaborating with
industry leaders and educational institutions. We aim to create positive change and create an
environment where everyone can succeed.

title: Women in Computer Science
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Women in Computer Science (WCS) nonprofit dedicated to supporting the efforts of young women and non-binary people pursuing careers in CS or show interests in technology. We aim to provide professional development, mentoring opportunities, and a safe and inclusive community on those historically underrepresented in Computer Science.
membership_benefits:
- Attend networking and social events with our corporate sponsors
- Learn from workshops on topics from technical skills to professional and academic advice
- Community building events for our members to have fun
- Grow your leadership skills

title: Women In CyberSecurity Student Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: Women in CyberSecurity (WiCyS) is a student chapter of a larger non-profit national organization dedicated to bringing together women in cybersecurity from academia, research and industry to share knowledge, experience, networking and mentoring. This RSO helps women interested in cyber security through tech talks, workshops, networking opportunities, research, conferences, and leadership opportunities. Our members are given the opportunity to attend the annual WiCyS National Conference and network with companies and fellow students passionate about the field of cyber security. WiCyS aims to provide a supportive community to women in all stages of their pursuit of a cybersecurity career.

title: Women in Data Science Urbana-Champaign
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Community Service & Philanthropy, Identity & Culture, Information & Data Sciences, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Women in Data Science (WiDS) works to empower women in the field of data science and increase the participation of women in the field. All identities, majors, and years are welcome to our events, with women-led participation encouraged.

title: Women in Electrical and Computer Engineering
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: We are WECE, the Women in Electrical and Computer Engineering - a student organization at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign dedicated to supporting women within the Illinois ECE department. We welcome members of all genders to be active in the group, and we strive to build communities amongst ourselves by hosting social, technical, outreach, and professional events!

title: Women in Mechanical Science and Engineering
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: Women in Mechanical Science and Engineering (WIM) aims to provide an inclusive and open social community for women and gender minorities within the Department of Mechanical Science and Engineering at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. WIM strives to increase the growth and leadership of women and gender minorities within the department and provide professional, social, and academic resources to its members.

title: Women in Music
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission: Our mission as an RSO is to support women majoring in music at UIUC and provide opportunities for those women and their supporters.
membership_benefits: Gain or give support to women majoring in music at UIUC.

title: Women in Nuclear Student Chapter at the University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Environmental & Sustainability, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission: The purpose of the University of Illinois Women in Nuclear Student Chapter is to provide students with opportunities to learn about nuclear science, participate in educational outreach programs, professionally develop its members, and advocacy.

title: Women in Psychology
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Social & Behavioral Sciences, Social & Leisure
mission:
The purpose of Women in Psychology - UIUC [WIP] is to empower people in the
psychology and psychology-adjacent fields. We want to bring together students with similar
interests to learn more about psychology and the many possibilities a psychology degree holds.

title: Women in Statistics
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Information & Data Sciences
mission: The mission of WiS is to provide a safe space for women and other underrepresented groups to unite with Statistics. We strive to give back to communities, provide academic and career support for students in need, and build an abundant environment for women in statistics-related majors to reach their goals.

title: Women of Color
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture
mission: Women of Color serves as an organization that strives to educate, uplift, and unite minority women on the University of Illinois campus and in the greater Champaign-Urbana community.

title: Women of Pride
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Identity & Culture, Ideology & Politics, Social & Leisure
mission: Women of Pride aims to create a safe and inclusive community for queer students regardless of gender identity or sexuality. Women of Pride also aims to promote inclusive thought and action on campus by hosting and promoting campus educational events and by endorsing relevant student activist movements.

title: Women's Glee Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
The purpose(s) of this organization shall be to rehearse and perform various treble repertoire.
Additionally, the purpose is to conduct social activities.

title: Women's Resources Center (WRC)
tags:
Student Affairs Departments & Programs
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Health & Wellness, Social & Leisure
mission: Since its founding in 2009, the Women’s Resources Center has been committed to supporting women students, while catalyzing the development of their personal and professional selves. Staff are committed to supporting and actualizing liberation in all aspects of the Center’s work, striving for greater equity, retention, advancement, and empowerment of women students, staff, and faculty.

title: Women's Undergraduate Law Society
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Law
mission: The purpose of the Women’s Undergraduate Law Society is to provide an environment/organization for prospective women lawyers. Concerns of women applying for law school, as well as concerns for professional careers will be discussed regarding how we can make an impact in the law field. Create a welcoming environment for women interested in exploring the legal field.

title: WPGU-FM 107.1
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts, Performance Arts
mission:
The purpose(s) of this organization shall be to train the broadcasters and media professionals of the
future.

title: Wrapsody Dance Co.
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
Wrapsody Dance Company serves as a creative dance company on campus that
creates a space for women and men to express themselves through different dance styles to
promote confidence. We want to empower individuals who feel they have no other voice to use
dance as their voice to speak. Our goal is to ensure that our dances tell stories of the unheard. We
also want to ensure that there is a space on campus for dancers who feel that they do not belong
in any category of dance simply just want to move as an art form.

title: Wrestling Club at University of Illinois
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Health & Wellness
mission: The Wrestling Club will be a club open to all, despite varied wrestling experiences from zero formal training to a former state champion. As a club, our purpose is to safely and properly provide the space to members and teach wrestlers various techniques, awarnesses, and the rules of the sport while avoiding a hostile environment. We will mostly operate under intrasquad competition, but will keep our minds open to the expansion of our competition, beyond the club itself.

title: Writers Organizing Realistic Dialect
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Health & Wellness, Performance Arts, Social & Leisure
mission:
WORD UIUC is an organization dedicated to the judgement free expression of
African American voices through the methods of written, spoken, and sung word.

title: Written Arts and Media Club
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Media Arts
mission: We're a club geared towards supporting aspiring media creators of all types and fostering a community of creatives!

title: X-Time at UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Education, Pedagogy & Instruction, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics
mission: X-Time UIUC empowers the next generation by expanding access to STEAM education for youth in the community and beyond. Through hands-on activities, cross-disciplinary collaboration, and outreach led by UIUC students from diverse majors, we inspire curiosity, creativity, and confidence.

title: Xtension Chords A Cappella
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Performance Arts
mission:
The purpose(s) of Xtension Chords A Cappella is to serve as an all-male competitive a cappella
group and perform for various organizations on and off campus.

title: Yarn & Unity
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Identity & Culture, Social & Leisure
mission: Our purpose is to create a community for Black/African/African American students to learn, practice, and teach each other about different yarn centered crafts. This organization is dedicated to ensuring it is a welcoming and safe space to those who seek to learn and create with yarn.

title: Young Americans for Freedom
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Ideology & Politics
mission: Young Americans for Freedom (YAF) is committed to ensuring that increasing numbers of young Americans understand and are inspired by the ideas of individual freedom, a strong national defense, free enterprise, and traditional values. As the principal outreach organization of the Conservative Movement, YAF introduces thousands of American youth to these principles. We accomplish our mission by providing essential conferences, seminars, educational materials, internships, and speakers to young people across the country.

title: Young Democratic Socialists of America
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Advocacy & Activism, Ideology & Politics
mission:
We work closely with Champaign-Urbana Democratic Socialists of America (CU DSA) to foster political engagement among youth in the Champaign-Urbana area, especially those attending the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (UIUC). UIUC YDSA shall organize campus and community rallies, host talks on a variety of political, social and economic topics, engage in community service, and facilitate grassroots organization in support of just and equitable society. Within and throughout this struggle, we will articulate and defend the idea that true human liberation is impossible under capitalism. We seek social change which extends democracy into all aspects of life—social, political and economic. This is the struggle for democratic socialism. Our
vision of socialism is profoundly democratic, feminist, and anti‐racist.

title: Yu-Gi-Oh Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure
mission: The Yu-Gi-Oh Illini serves as place to allow students to meet a group of like-minded individuals who share an interest/hobby in the Yu-Gi-Oh trading card game, as well as a place to participate in and create events for the game. The Yu-Gi-Oh Illini aims to promote a positive and fun environment for all who wish to enjoy the shared interest.

title: Zamo Illini
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Agricultural, Environmental & Sustainability
mission: Zamo Illini is a subchapter of the Zamorano Alumnus Association-United States (AGEAP-USA). The purpose of this organization is to promote student networking at a graduate level under the fields of agricultural sciences, food science and environmental sciences research through alumnus from Zamorano University in Honduras actively enrolled in their program at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign.
membership_benefits:
Eligible members shall have:
Voting rights
Ability to travel with Zamo Illini
Free admission to Zamo Illini events

title: Zero2One
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Business, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics, ~ Affiliation: Grainger College of Engineering
mission:
The purpose of this organization shall be:
1. Run a venture incubator program for ambitious and hardworking
students to form small teams with like-minded teammates and work on
ideas they are passionate about.
2. Provide the opportunity for students to receive feedback and support
from our multidisciplinary community, resources, and mentors.
3. Host entrepreneurial public events and programs to inspire more
students.
4. Form a strong community of student entrepreneurs.

title: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Inc. Nu Delta Chapter
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Community Service & Philanthropy, Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission: Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated strives to be a community-conscious, action-oriented organization dedicated to fostering positive relationships amongst women and the community. Our five Triumphant Founders had a vision to form a sorority which would "directly affect positive change, chart a course of action for the 1920s and beyond, raise people's consciousness, encourage the highest standards of scholastic achievement" and so much more. Our current chapter, the Nu Delta Chapter, strives to carry out this mission on a localized campus/community level.
membership_benefits: Joining Zeta Phi Beta Sorority, Incorporated will offer young women the opportunities to create lifelong connections, friendships, and sisterhood. Through our commitment to our four principles, Scholarship, Service, Sisterhood, and Finer Womanhood, members are able to directly impact the community and others in a positive way, guaranteeing self-satisfaction and personal growth.

title: Zeta Psi Fraternity
tags:
Blue Student Organization
 
 - Social & Leisure, Social Fraternities & Sororities
mission:
The primary purpose of the fraternity shall be to aid and encourage its student members
to achieve that development of character, intellect, and leadership, and that capacity for human
relationships which are commensurate with the highest aims and purpose of university education
at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign; and, generally, the fraternity shall form a
lifelong bond of brotherhood, as devoted to the fulfillment of the ideals expressed in the ritual
and to the fellowship of its members.

title: Zindaa UIUC
tags:
Orange Student Organization
 
 - Athletic & Recreation, Identity & Culture, Performance Arts
mission: Zindaa UIUC serves to spread Indian culture and our passion for dance.
